_net.name: .NET
_net.description: .NET is a versatile, open-source development platform created by Microsoft, enabling developers to build applications for various platforms, including web, mobile, desktop, cloud, and more. It includes a comprehensive framework that supports multiple programming languages, libraries, and tools. .NET is widely used for creating enterprise-level applications due to its scalability, security, and performance capabilities.

_net_stack_with_microservices.name: .NET Stack with Microservices
_net_stack_with_microservices.description: .NET Stack with Microservices proficiency and expertise

2g.name: 2G
2g.description: 2G, or second-generation mobile technology, refers to the digital cellular technology that succeeded first-generation systems. It primarily focuses on voice communication and simple data services, such as SMS (Short Message Service). 2G enhances call quality and security compared to analog systems. This technology is foundational in mobile telecommunications, paving the way for advanced services and higher-speed data transmission in subsequent generations (3G, 4G, and beyond), as well as enabling the widespread adoption of mobile phones.

3g.name: 3G
3g.description: 3G, or third-generation technology, refers to mobile telecommunications standards that enable higher data transmission rates and improved connectivity for mobile devices. This skill encompasses understanding 3G networks' capabilities, such as enhanced internet access, video calling, and multimedia streaming. Professionals skilled in 3G can optimize mobile networks, troubleshoot connectivity issues, and facilitate the development of applications that leverage these faster data speeds, contributing to comprehensive mobile communication solutions.

5g.name: 5G
5g.description: 5G, or fifth-generation wireless technology, offers significantly faster data speeds, reduced latency, and increased connectivity compared to previous generations. It enables seamless communication for mobile devices, IoT (Internet of Things), and smart city infrastructure. 5G is used to support advanced applications like augmented reality, autonomous vehicles, and smart homes, enhancing user experiences and facilitating real-time data exchange across various sectors, including healthcare, entertainment, and manufacturing.

5g_applications.name: 5G Applications
5g_applications.description: 5G applications refer to the innovative uses and services that leverage the capabilities of the fifth generation of mobile networks. This skill encompasses the development and implementation of technologies such as enhanced mobile broadband, ultra-reliable low-latency communications, and massive machine-type communications. It is critical for enabling advancements in areas like smart cities, autonomous vehicles, telemedicine, and augmented reality, ultimately enhancing connectivity and transforming industries through high-speed data transmission and reliable connectivity.

ab_testing.name: A/B Testing
ab_testing.description: A/B testing(also known as split testing or bucket testing) is a method used to compare two variations (A and B) of a webpage, app feature, or marketing campaign to determine which version fits well with the business requirments. It's widely used in product development to make data-driven decisions and enhancing end user experience.

abap_git_and_github.name: ABAP Git and GitHub
abap_git_and_github.description: ABAP Git and GitHub encompasses proficiency in effectively managing and version controlling ABAP (Advanced Business Application Programming) code using Git and GitHub platforms.

abs.name: ABS
abs.description: The Allianz Business System (ABS) is an integrated IT platform designed to manage various aspects of Allianz's insurance and financial operations. It supports policy management, claims processing, customer relationship management, underwriting, billing, and regulatory compliance. ABS enhances operational efficiency, customer service, and compliance, making it a critical component of Allianz's business infrastructure.

acceptance_criteria.name: Acceptance Criteria
acceptance_criteria.description: Acceptance Criteria is the ability to define the conditions that must be satisfied for a product, user story, or increment of work to be accepted.

access_control.name: Access Control
access_control.description: Access Control refers to the practice of managing who or what is allowed to access or use resources within a computing environment. It involves establishing policies, protocols, and systems to regulate user permissions and privileges, ensuring that only authorized individuals can access sensitive data and systems. This skill is crucial for enhancing security, protecting confidential information, and preventing unauthorized access to resources, thereby safeguarding organizations against data breaches and cyber threats.

accident_and_illness_claims_settlement.name: Accident and Illness Claims Settlement
accident_and_illness_claims_settlement.description: Accident and Illness Claims Settlement involves the process of settling insurance claims related to accidents and illnesses covered under various insurance policies. Claims professionals specializing in accident and illness claims settlement manage the evaluation, negotiation, and resolution of claims arising from bodily injuries, medical expenses, disability, or illness-related losses. They review claim documentation, assess the extent of coverage, verify claimant eligibility, and negotiate settlement terms with policyholders, healthcare providers, and other stakeholders.

accounting_for_securities_and_derivative.name: Accounting for Securities and Derivatives (CIV IAS)
accounting_for_securities_and_derivative.description: Accounting for Securities and Derivatives (CIV IAS) involves applying accounting principles and standards to accurately record and report transactions related to financial instruments such as stocks, bonds, and derivatives. This includes determining the initial recognition, subsequent measurement, and presentation of these instruments in financial statements.

accounting_principles.name: Accounting Principles
accounting_principles.description: Accounting Principles refer to the fundamental rules and guidelines that govern the preparation and presentation of financial statements. These principles provide a framework for recording, classifying, and summarizing financial transactions to facilitate meaningful interpretation and analysis of an organization's financial performance and position.

accounting_principles_ifrs_9__17.name: Accounting Principles: IFRS 9 / 17
accounting_principles_ifrs_9__17.description: Accounting Principles: IFRS 9 / 17 proficiency and expertise

accounting_processes_for_life_policies.name: Accounting Processes for Life Policies
accounting_processes_for_life_policies.description: Accounting Processes for Life Policies involve managing and recording transactions related to life insurance policies, including premium payments, policyholder benefits, and reserves.

accounting_system_management.name: Accounting System Management
accounting_system_management.description: Proficiency in overseeing and managing the accounting system within an organization, including configuring software settings, implementing controls, and ensuring accurate recording and reporting of financial transactions in compliance with accounting standards.

accounting_systems.name: Accounting Systems
accounting_systems.description: Accounting systems are structured methods and processes used to record, manage, and report financial transactions and data. They help organizations track income, expenses, assets, and liabilities, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. These systems facilitate financial analysis, budget management, and decision-making by providing accurate financial information. Common types of accounting systems include manual bookkeeping, spreadsheet-based systems, and comprehensive software applications like ERP systems, all of which support effective financial management and operational efficiency.

accounts_payable.name: Accounts Payable
accounts_payable.description: Accounts Payable is a financial accounting term that refers to the money owed by a business to its suppliers or vendors for goods and services purchased on credit. The accounts payable process involves recording and tracking invoices received from suppliers, verifying the accuracy of invoices against purchase orders and receiving reports, approving payments, and disbursing funds to suppliers within agreed-upon terms.

actimize.name: Actimize
actimize.description: Actimize is a software platform used for financial crime prevention, detection, and compliance. It offers solutions for anti-money laundering (AML), fraud detection, market surveillance, and trading compliance. Professionals proficient in Actimize possess the skills to implement, configure, and manage the Actimize platform to effectively monitor and mitigate financial risks, ensure regulatory compliance, and safeguard against fraudulent activities within insurance operations.

active_directory.name: Active Directory
active_directory.description: Active Directory (AD) is a directory service developed by Microsoft that manages users, devices, and applications within a network. It is used for authentication, authorization, and organization of resources in a centralized manner, allowing administrators to enforce security policies, manage user access, and streamline resource allocation. Active Directory plays a crucial role in enterprise environments for network administration, enabling efficient user management and enhancing organizational security.

active_directory_federation_services_adf.name: Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)
active_directory_federation_services_adf.description: Active Directory Federation Servicesis the proficiency in deploying and managing ADFS, a component of Microsoft's Active Directory services used for single sign-on (SSO) authentication across organizational boundaries. This skill involves expertise in configuring trust relationships, identity federation, and access policies to enable secure access to data resources and applications within hybrid IT environments.

active_listening.name: Active Listening
active_listening.description: Active Listening is the ability to fully concentrate, understand, and respond thoughtfully to what others are saying, ensuring effective communication.

active_sourcing.name: Active Sourcing
active_sourcing.description: Active Sourcing is the proactive approach to identifying and engaging potential candidates for job opportunities. It involves using various channels, such as social media and networking, to build a pipeline of qualified talent before positions become available.

actuarial_models.name: Actuarial Models
actuarial_models.description: Fundamentals of Actuarial Modeling refers to the understanding and application of mathematical and statistical techniques to analyze and model risk in insurance and financial contexts.

actuarial_pricing.name: Actuarial Pricing
actuarial_pricing.description: Advanced pricing: the ability to develop technical premiums required for an individual insurance policy to sufficiently cover the expected cost of claims, external and internal expenses and achieve the long term financial targets, using advanced statistical and analytical methods which produce the most accurate estimate of premiums.

actuarial_reserves.name: Actuarial Reserves
actuarial_reserves.description: Actuarial Reserves refers to the estimated liabilities that insurance companies set aside to cover future claims and obligations arising from insurance policies or contracts. Professionals with this skill are responsible for calculating and maintaining actuarial reserves, which represent the present value of expected future claim payments, benefits, and expenses.

actuarial_science.name: Actuarial Science
actuarial_science.description: Actuarial Science encompasses the application of mathematical and statistical techniques to assess and manage financial risks in insurance and related industries. Professionals with this skill analyze data, such as mortality rates, claim frequencies, and investment returns, to evaluate and quantify risks associated with insurance policies and financial products.

actuarial_statistical_models.name: Actuarial Statistical Models
actuarial_statistical_models.description: Actuarial Statistical Models involve the development and application of mathematical frameworks to analyze and quantify risks in insurance and related industries. Professionals with this skill use statistical techniques and methodologies to construct models that represent the probability distributions of uncertain events, such as insurance claims, mortality rates, or investment returns.

actuarial_tools_used_in_reinsurance.name: Actuarial Tools Used in Reinsurance
actuarial_tools_used_in_reinsurance.description: Actuarial Tools Used in Reinsurance proficiency and expertise

actuarial_use_of_development_tools.name: Actuarial Use of Development Tools
actuarial_use_of_development_tools.description: The actuarial use of development tools involves leveraging software and analytical applications to assess financial risks, model future events, and analyze data relevant to insurance and pension sectors. This skill enables actuaries to create effective forecasts, optimize pricing strategies, and evaluate policy performance. Proficiency in these tools enhances an actuary’s ability to deliver precise insights, support decision-making, and ensure sound financial planning within organizations.

acunetix.name: Acunetix
acunetix.description: Acunetix is a web application security scanner that automates the detection of vulnerabilities in websites and web applications. It identifies security risks such as SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and other vulnerabilities that could be exploited by attackers. This skill is crucial for cybersecurity professionals who aim to enhance the security posture of web applications, ensuring compliance with security standards and protecting sensitive data from potential breaches.

adabas.name: ADABAS
adabas.description: ADABAS (Adaptable DAta BAse System) is a high-performance database management system primarily used for managing large volumes of data in mainframe environments. It supports direct access to data, facilitating fast retrieval and processing. ADABAS is commonly utilized in industries that require efficient transaction processing and data management, such as finance, healthcare, and telecommunications, enabling organizations to handle complex data operations while ensuring data integrity and speed.

adaptability.name: Adaptability
adaptability.description: Adaptability refers to the ability to adjust and thrive in changing environments, demonstrating flexibility and a willingness to embrace new challenges.

administration_of_hr_systems.name: Administration of HR Systems
administration_of_hr_systems.description: Administration of HR Systems entails managing and maintaining human resource information systems (HRIS) to ensure accurate and efficient handling of employee data, payroll, and other HR functions.

administration_of_new__post_underwriting.name: Administration of New / Post Underwriting Cancellations
administration_of_new__post_underwriting.description: Administration of New / Post Underwriting Cancellations proficiency and expertise

administrative_compliance_checks.name: Administrative Compliance Checks
administrative_compliance_checks.description: Administrative Compliance Checks involves ensuring that administrative processes within an insurance company comply with relevant regulations, internal policies, and industry standards.

administrative_procedural_law.name: Administrative Procedural Law
administrative_procedural_law.description: Administrative Procedural Law proficiency and expertise

administrative_procedures_for_rental_con.name: Administrative Procedures for Rental Contracts
administrative_procedures_for_rental_con.description: Administrative Procedures for Rental Contracts proficiency and expertise

administrative_processes_in_underwriting.name: Administrative Processes in Underwriting
administrative_processes_in_underwriting.description: Administrative Processes in Underwriting encompasses efficiently managing documentation, data entry, and communication channels throughout the underwriting cycle. Underwriters ensure that all necessary information is collected, processed, and documented accurately and in compliance with regulatory requirements and company policies.

administrative_support.name: Administrative Support
administrative_support.description: Administrative Support involves providing essential organizational and logistical assistance to ensure smooth and efficient workflow operations. This skill includes tasks such as scheduling, documentation, communication facilitation, and data management.

adobe_analytics_developer.name: Adobe Analytics Developer
adobe_analytics_developer.description: Adobe Analytics Developer encompasses proficiency in developing and implementing solutions using Adobe Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Adobe Systems.

adobe_campaign.name: Adobe Campaign
adobe_campaign.description: Adobe Campaign encompasses proficiency in developing and implementing marketing campaigns using Adobe Campaign, a comprehensive platform for managing and automating marketing campaigns across multiple channels.

adobe_creative_cloud.name: Adobe Creative Cloud
adobe_creative_cloud.description: Adobe Creative Cloud is a suite of software applications and services designed for creative professionals. It includes tools for graphic design (Photoshop), video editing (Premiere Pro), web development (Adobe XD), and more. This skill enables users to create, edit, and manage visual content across various media formats. Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud is essential for careers in graphic design, multimedia production, marketing, and web design, allowing professionals to bring their creative visions to life effectively.

adobe_experience_manager.name: Adobe Experience Manager
adobe_experience_manager.description: Adobe Experience Manager encompasses proficiency in developing and managing web content and digital experiences using Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), a comprehensive content management solution that enables organizations to create, manage, and deliver personalized content across various channels and devices.

adobe_illustrator.name: Adobe Illustrator
adobe_illustrator.description: Adobe Illustrator encompasses proficiency in creating vector graphics and illustrations using Adobe Illustrator, a powerful software application widely used by graphic designers, illustrators, and artists for creating logos, icons, typography, and complex illustrations with precision and scalability.

adobe_xd.name: Adobe XD
adobe_xd.description: Adobe XD encompasses proficiency in designing and prototyping user interfaces and experiences using Adobe XD.

adsr_filenet_p8.name: ADSR (FileNet P8)
adsr_filenet_p8.description: ADSR (Application Document Services Repository) in FileNet P8 is a component that facilitates the management and storage of documents and records within a secure enterprise repository. It enables users to create, retrieve, and manage documents while ensuring compliance and workflows. ADSR integrates with various applications, providing a central point for document lifecycle management, storage optimization, and access control, enhancing overall business efficiency.

advanced_endpoint_protection_aep.name: Advanced Endpoint Protection (AEP)
advanced_endpoint_protection_aep.description: Advanced Endpoint Protection (AEP) is a cybersecurity skill focused on safeguarding endpoint devices—such as computers, mobile phones, and servers—from sophisticated threats. It involves implementing and managing security solutions that detect, prevent, and respond to malware, ransomware, and other cyberattacks. AEP combines techniques like real-time threat intelligence, behavioral analysis, and automated response mechanisms to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of sensitive data while maintaining operational efficiency across organizational networks.

advanced_malware_detection_amd.name: Advanced Malware Detection (AMD)
advanced_malware_detection_amd.description: Advanced Malware Detection (AMD) refers to the use of sophisticated techniques and tools to identify and analyze malware threats that could compromise computer systems and networks. This skill involves understanding behavioral analysis, signature detection, and heuristic techniques to recognize malicious software. AMD is crucial for cybersecurity professionals to prevent data breaches, protect sensitive information, and ensure the integrity of IT infrastructure by mitigating the risks posed by increasingly complex malware attacks.

advanced_powershell.name: Advanced Powershell
advanced_powershell.description: Advanced PowerShell refers to the capability to utilize PowerShell scripting beyond basic commands, enabling users to automate complex tasks, manage system configurations, and integrate with various software applications and services. This skill involves writing scripts, utilizing advanced functions, and leveraging modules to streamline workflows, enhance system administration, and facilitate data manipulation. It's essential for IT professionals looking to optimize processes, improve efficiency, and maintain control over automated environments in both local and cloud infrastructures.

aem_dispatcher.name: AEM Dispatcher
aem_dispatcher.description: Adobe caching and /or load balancing tool

agency_management.name: Agency Management
agency_management.description: Agency Management refers to the skills needed to oversee and coordinate the operations of an agency, ensuring its alignment with business goals and client needs.

agile.name: Agile
agile.description: Agile is a mindset focused on delivering value through iterative and incremental development. It emphasizes collaboration, customer feedback, and adaptability to change. In a software development context, Agile involves working in short cycles, continuously improving processes, and empowering teams to make decisions.

agile_coaching.name: Agile Coaching
agile_coaching.description: Agile Coaching involves providing guidance, support, and mentorship to individuals, teams, and organizations as they adopt and implement agile principles and practices. Agile coaches work closely with teams and stakeholders to foster an environment conducive to agile methodologies, facilitating the development of self-organizing, cross-functional teams that deliver value iteratively and incrementally.

agile_collaboration.name: Agile Collaboration
agile_collaboration.description: Agile Collaboration is to know how to work flexibly in multifunctional teams, adopt lean working methods in everyday life and have a culture of experimentation

agile_leadership.name: Agile Leadership
agile_leadership.description: Agile Leadership refers to a leadership style that emphasizes adaptability, collaboration, and empowering teams to respond quickly to changing conditions and opportunities.

agile_methodologies.name: Agile Methodologies
agile_methodologies.description: Agile methodologies are a set of principles for software development and project management that emphasize flexibility, collaboration, and customer feedback. They focus on iterative progress, cross-functional teams, and adaptive planning to deliver high-quality products efficiently.

agile_mindset.name: Agile Mindset
agile_mindset.description: The skill Agile Mindset refers to a way of thinking and working that emphasizes adaptability, collaboration, and continuous improvement in response to changing circumstances. Individuals with this skill approach challenges and opportunities with openness, flexibility, and a willingness to learn from experience.

agile_product_owner.name: Agile Product Owner
agile_product_owner.description: The Agile Product Owner skill for employees involves taking on the role of the Product Owner within an agile development team, responsible for maximizing the value of the product and ensuring that the team delivers features and functionality that meet customer needs and business objectives.

agile_project_management.name: Agile Project Management
agile_project_management.description: The Agile Project Management skill for employees involves overseeing and facilitating the execution of projects using agile methodologies, with a focus on delivering value incrementally, adapting to change, and promoting collaboration within the team.

agile_testing.name: Agile Testing
agile_testing.description: Agile Testing is a software testing practice that follows the principles of Agile methodologies, emphasizing iterative development, collaboration, and flexibility. It involves continuous testing throughout the software development lifecycle to ensure that software is adaptive to changes and meets users' needs. Agile Testing uses various techniques, such as test-driven development (TDD), behavior-driven development (BDD), and exploratory testing, enabling teams to deliver high-quality products rapidly and efficiently.

ai_and_machine_learning.name: AI and Machine Learning
ai_and_machine_learning.description: AI and Machine Learning refers to the development of algorithms and systems that enable computers to perform tasks that typically require human intelligence. This skill involves understanding data, recognizing patterns, and making decisions or predictions based on input data. It is used in various applications, such as natural language processing, image recognition, recommendation systems, and autonomous vehicles, driving innovation across industries by enhancing efficiency and enabling more informed decision-making.

ai_architecture.name: AI Architecture
ai_architecture.description: AI Architecture refers to the design and structuring of systems and frameworks that enable artificial intelligence applications to operate effectively. It encompasses the integration of algorithms, data management, and computational resources to create scalable and efficient AI solutions. This skill is essential for developing and optimizing AI models, ensuring they can process data, learn patterns, and deliver insights in real time, ultimately enhancing decision-making processes and automating tasks across various industries.

aimacts.name: AIM/ACTS
aimacts.description: ACTS (Allianz Cash and Treasury System) is Mainframe based system which is currently getting migrated to new Allianz treasury platform (ATP) ,which is mainly based on applications TRAX and Quantum.

ai_powered_threat_detection.name: AI-Powered Threat Detection
ai_powered_threat_detection.description: AI-Powered Threat Detection is the ability to leverage artificial intelligence algorithms and machine learning models to identify, analyze, and mitigate potential security threats in real-time. This skill involves monitoring data patterns, recognizing anomalies, and predicting vulnerabilities across various systems and networks. It is used in cybersecurity to enhance the protection of digital assets, prevent data breaches, and ensure the integrity of information by proactively addressing risks before they manifest into significant issues.

air_conf.name: Air Conf
air_conf.description: Air Conf software helps to design, analyze, and optimize cooling systems for buildings. It assists in choosing the right equipment, calculating cooling needs, and ensuring energy efficiency. The software also helps with duct design, compliance with regulations, and generating reports. It simplifies the process of creating comfortable indoor environments while meeting standards and client needs.

airtable.name: Airtable
airtable.description: Cloud-based software platform to create and organize information in a customizable table format

airwavefaçade_framework.name: Airwave/Façade Framework
airwavefaçade_framework.description: Airwave Facade Framework is a software development skill focused on simplifying complex applications. It provides a unified interface, called a facade, to a set of subsystems, making it easier to use and understand. The framework promotes abstraction, encapsulation, and flexibility, particularly useful in integrating multiple subsystems, handling complex architectures, and managing legacy codebases. It enhances code organization, reduces coupling, and improves system scalability.

ajax.name: AJAX
ajax.description: Web development technique for web applications

akamai_web_application_firewall_and_cont.name: Akamai Web Application Firewall and Content Delivery Network
akamai_web_application_firewall_and_cont.description: Akamai Web Application Firewall (WAF) is a security solution that protects web applications by filtering and monitoring HTTP traffic between a client and server, defending against threats like SQL injection and cross-site scripting. The Content Delivery Network (CDN) enhances website performance by distributing content across global servers, reducing load times and server strain. Together, they ensure secure, fast, and reliable user experiences for online applications.

akan.name: Akan
akan.description: Akan encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

allianz_agile_blueprint.name: Allianz Agile Blueprint
allianz_agile_blueprint.description: Allianz Agile Blueprint proficiency and expertise

allianz_customer_model___acm.name: Allianz Customer Model - ACM
allianz_customer_model___acm.description: ACM is a core driver of the overall Allianz Group strategy to achieve simplicity and become a more customer centric organization. ACM is being positioned as the framework that is changing Allianz from the inside out so that products, processes, and services are designed around what the customer needs.

allianz_group_standards.name: Allianz Group Standards
allianz_group_standards.description: Allianz Group Standards are a set of rules, regulations, and guidelines that are to be followed by all IT personnel, departments, and divisions within the Allianz Group. These standards cover a wide range of topics, including system and data security, software development, and IT infrastructure. They provide a framework for organizations to ensure that their IT systems are secure, reliable, and properly managed. Allianz Group Standards are designed to ensure the security, reliability, and efficiency of all corporate IT systems across the Allianz Group. These standards are regularly reviewed and updated to ensure they remain up-to-date with industry best practices and regulatory requirements. They provide guidance on how to manage and secure data, systems, and applications, as well as how to develop and deploy IT solutions. They also include requirements for data and system protection, IT procurement, and compliance with industry standards.

allianz_groups_informative_tools_da_spri.name: Allianz Group's Informative Tools (DA, Sprint, Quad)
allianz_groups_informative_tools_da_spri.description: Allianz Group's Informative Tools include data analytics (DA), Sprint, and Quad, designed to streamline decision-making processes. DA uses data analysis to foster insights from large datasets, enhancing strategic business decisions. Sprint is an agile project management framework that accelerates workflows and improves team collaboration. Quad provides a comprehensive dashboard for visualization and reporting, aiding in performance tracking. Together, these tools empower organizations to leverage data effectively, innovate, and optimize operational efficiency.

allianz_organizational_structure.name: Allianz Organizational Structure
allianz_organizational_structure.description: Allianz Organizational Structure proficiency and expertise

allianz_standards_for_personal_computer_.name: Allianz Standards for Personal Computer User Experience
allianz_standards_for_personal_computer_.description: Allianz Standards for Personal Computer User Experience encompasses a set of guidelines and best practices aimed at optimizing the usability, functionality, and aesthetic of personal computer systems within Allianz. This skill focuses on ensuring a seamless, efficient, and user-friendly experience for employees through standardized interfaces, configurations, and support tools.

allianz_systems.name: Allianz Systems
allianz_systems.description: Allianz Systems is a type of software used to provide an integrated and cost-effective approach to managing an organization's financial and operational tasks. Allianz Systems is a comprehensive suite of applications that are integrated to provide a unified view of an organization's financial, operational, and reporting processes. It includes modules such as budgeting and forecasting, financial consolidation, planning and analysis, capital investment, and performance management. Allianz Systems also provides features such as user-friendly dashboards, customizable reporting, and analytics. The software enables organizations to streamline their management process, allowing for improved planning and decision making. This can help organizations improve efficiency, reduce costs and increase profitability. Allianz Systems is also designed to provide enhanced security and data protection, ensuring that the data stored is secure and compliant with industry standards.

allianzu_learning_platform.name: AllianzU Learning Platform
allianzu_learning_platform.description: AllianzU Learning Platform, powered by Degreed, is an educational resource to support employee development. It offers diverse learning opportunities, including courses, workshops, and training programs, aimed at enhancing skills, knowledge, and career growth within the organization.

allocation_of_management_events_in_the_c.name: Allocation of Management Events in the Chart of Accounts
allocation_of_management_events_in_the_c.description: Allocation of Management Events in the Chart of Accounts is the categorizing and assigning management events or transactions to specific accounts within the chart of accounts, ensuring proper classification, consistency, and accuracy in financial reporting and analysis.

alternative_assets.name: Alternative Assets
alternative_assets.description: Fundamentals of Alternative Assets refer to non-traditional investment options beyond stocks, bonds, and cash, such as private equity, hedge funds, commodities, real estate, or cryptocurrencies. Individuals with this skill understand and manage alternative assets as part of diversified investment portfolios, seeking to generate higher returns or hedge against market volatility.

alteryx.name: Alteryx
alteryx.description: Alteryx is a data analytics platform used for data preparation, blending, and advanced analytics. It enables users to connect to various data sources, perform complex data transformations, and create predictive models using a user-friendly, drag-and-drop interface. This skill is essential for data analysts and business intelligence professionals who seek to streamline data analysis processes, improve data-driven decision-making, and derive actionable insights from diverse datasets efficiently.

amazon_aurora.name: Amazon Aurora
amazon_aurora.description: Amazon Aurora is a cloud-based relational database service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). It is designed for high performance and availability, compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL. Aurora automatically scales storage and compute resources based on application demand, ensuring efficient performance and cost-effectiveness. It is used for building scalable applications, data warehousing, and real-time analytics, making it ideal for businesses that require robust database solutions without the complexity of traditional database management.

amazon_cloudfront.name: Amazon CloudFront
amazon_cloudfront.description: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) service that accelerates the distribution of website content, APIs, videos, and other applications to users globally. It caches copies of your content in multiple edge locations, reducing latency and improving load times. This skill is essential for optimizing website performance, enhancing user experience, and ensuring reliable content delivery at scale, making it valuable for businesses and developers looking to improve their web applications and services.

amazon_s3.name: Amazon S3
amazon_s3.description: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is a cloud-based storage solution provided by AWS (Amazon Web Services). It enables users to store, retrieve, and manage large volumes of data securely and efficiently. Businesses and developers use S3 for data backup, archiving, content distribution, and website hosting, among other applications. With features like scalability, high availability, and data redundancy, S3 is designed to support a wide range of workloads, making it a fundamental tool for digital asset management.

amazon_web_services.name: Amazon Web Services
amazon_web_services.description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) refers to a comprehensive cloud computing platform provided by Amazon, offering a wide range of services such as computing power, storage options, and networking. It enables businesses to scale their infrastructure, enhance flexibility, and reduce costs by paying only for what they use. AWS is commonly used for hosting applications, managing data, and deploying machine learning models, making it essential for developers, IT professionals, and organizations aiming to leverage cloud technology for growth and innovation.

amazon_web_services_administration.name: Amazon Web Services Administration
amazon_web_services_administration.description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) Administration involves managing and overseeing cloud services provided by AWS. This skill encompasses configuring, deploying, and maintaining cloud resources to ensure optimal performance, security, and cost-effectiveness. AWS Administrators utilize tools for monitoring, troubleshooting, and managing services like EC2, S3, and RDS. This skill is essential for organizations transitioning to the cloud, facilitating scalability, agility, and efficient resource management in a business environment.

amazon_web_services_architecture.name: Amazon Web Services Architecture
amazon_web_services_architecture.description: Amazon Web Services Architecture proficiency and expertise

amharic.name: Amharic
amharic.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

analog_gateways.name: Analog Gateways
analog_gateways.description: Analog gateways are devices that facilitate the connection between analog telecommunication systems and digital networks. They convert voice and data signals from traditional analog devices, such as phones and fax machines, into a digital format for transmission over IP networks. This skill is essential in environments where legacy systems need to interface with modern communication technologies, ensuring seamless communication within hybrid infrastructures and enhancing operational efficiency in both business and telecommunication settings.

analysis_and_evaluation_of_investments.name: Analysis and Evaluation of Investments
analysis_and_evaluation_of_investments.description: Analysis and Evaluation of Investments involves assessing investment opportunities to determine their potential risks and returns. It includes analyzing financial statements, market trends, and economic indicators to evaluate the feasibility and profitability of investments. Professionals with this skill can conduct thorough due diligence, apply investment valuation techniques, and make informed decisions to optimize investment portfolios and maximize returns for stakeholders.

analysis_and_planning_of_call_center_shi.name: Analysis and Planning of Call Center Shift Management
analysis_and_planning_of_call_center_shi.description: Analysis and Planning of Call Center Shift Management entails analyzing call center operations and planning shift schedules to ensure efficient staffing and resource utilization.

analysis_of_credit_risk_for_corporate_is.name: Analysis of Credit Risk for Corporate Issuers
analysis_of_credit_risk_for_corporate_is.description: Analysis of Credit Risk for Corporate Issuers involves evaluating the creditworthiness of corporate entities to assess the risk of default on their debt obligations. It includes analyzing financial statements, business operations, industry dynamics, and macroeconomic factors to gauge the likelihood of a company meeting its debt obligations.

analysis_of_investments_in_the_securitie.name: Analysis of Investments in the Securities Markets
analysis_of_investments_in_the_securitie.description: Analysis of Investments in the Securities Markets encompasses assessing various investment opportunities available in the securities markets, including stocks, bonds, mutual funds, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), and other financial instruments. It involves conducting fundamental and technical analysis, evaluating risk-return profiles, considering market trends and economic indicators, and applying valuation techniques to identify attractive investment options.

analysis_of_liabilities.name: Analysis of Liabilities
analysis_of_liabilities.description: Analysis of Liabilities proficiency and expertise

analysis_of_listed_companies_and_valuati.name: Analysis of Listed Companies and Valuation of Quotes
analysis_of_listed_companies_and_valuati.description: Analysis of Listed Companies and Valuation of Quotes involves analyzing publicly traded companies and determining the fair value of their shares based on fundamental and market factors. It includes assessing financial performance, growth prospects, competitive positioning, industry trends, and qualitative factors to arrive at an intrinsic value for a company's stock.

analysis_of_macroeconomic_evolution_of_t.name: Analysis of Macroeconomic Evolution of the Insurance System
analysis_of_macroeconomic_evolution_of_t.description: Analysis of Macroeconomic Evolution of Insurance System focuses on monitoring and analyzing macroeconomic factors and trends that impact the insurance industry. It involves studying economic indicators such as GDP growth, inflation rates, interest rates, and regulatory changes to understand their implications on insurance markets, customer behavior, and industry dynamics. Professionals with this skill can anticipate market shifts, identify emerging risks and opportunities, and formulate strategic responses to navigate the evolving insurance landscape.

analysis_of_management_and_control_of_ec.name: Analysis of Management and Control of Economic Profitability
analysis_of_management_and_control_of_ec.description: Analysis of Management and Control of Economic Profitability involves assessing the financial performance and profitability of an organization's operations and investments. It includes analyzing revenue streams, cost structures, and profitability ratios to evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of business activities. Professionals with this skill can identify areas for cost optimization, revenue enhancement, and margin improvement, enabling organizations to achieve sustainable economic profitability and long-term growth.

analysis_of_management_and_control_of_te.name: Analysis of Management and Control of Technical and Financial Risk
analysis_of_management_and_control_of_te.description: Analysis of Management and Control of Technical and Financial Risk focuses on identifying, assessing, and managing technical and financial risks within an organization. It involves analyzing insurance underwriting risks, investment risks, operational risks, and regulatory compliance risks to develop risk mitigation strategies and controls. Professionals with this skill can implement risk management frameworks, conduct risk assessments, and monitor risk exposures to safeguard the financial stability and resilience of insurance operations.

analysis_of_organizational_processes.name: Analysis of Organizational Processes
analysis_of_organizational_processes.description: Analysis of Organizational Processes involves analyzing the policies, procedures, workflows, and systems used within the policy management division to identify areas for improvement, efficiency gains, and risk mitigation.

analysis_of_profit_and_loss_account_for_.name: Analysis of Profit and Loss Account for Property and Casualty Insurance Companies
analysis_of_profit_and_loss_account_for_.description: Analysis of Profit and Loss Account for Property and Casualty Insurance Companies involves examining the financial statements of property and casualty insurance companies, focusing specifically on the profit and loss (P and L) account. It includes analyzing revenue streams, underwriting income, claims expenses, operating costs, investment income, and other factors impacting the company's profitability.

analytical_programming_languages.name: Analytical programming languages
analytical_programming_languages.description: Analytical programming languages are specialized languages designed for data analysis and statistical computing. They enable users to manipulate, visualize, and interpret complex datasets efficiently. Common examples include R, Python (with libraries like Pandas and NumPy), and MATLAB. These languages facilitate tasks such as data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling, making them essential tools for data scientists, analysts, and engineers in extracting insights and aiding decision-making based on data-driven evidence.

analytical_thinking.name: Analytical Thinking
analytical_thinking.description: Analytical Thinking refers to the ability to break down complex concepts and ideas into smaller, manageable parts, and then evaluate and solve them. It involves identifying patterns, making connections, understanding cause and effect relationships, and deriving meaningful insights from data or information.

analytics.name: Analytics
analytics.description: Analytics is the ability to interpret and analyse information, extract meaningful insights and evaluate options for decision making.

analytics_documentation.name: Analytics Documentation
analytics_documentation.description: Analytics Documentation is the process of creating, organizing and using documents related to data analytics. This includes planning documents that explain the objectives of the analysis, technical documents that provide details on the data sources, tools and processes used, and presentation documents that explain the results of the analysis. Proper analytics documentation helps ensure accuracy and consistency of results, simplifying the interpretation and providing a reference for future work. The most common form of analytics documentation is a data dictionary, which lists all of the data elements used in the analysis and provides a brief description of each element. Other forms of analytics documentation can range from flowcharts and diagrams that explain the analytical workflow to user manuals that detail the steps of the analysis.

android.name: Android
android.description: Android refers to a mobile operating system developed by Google, primarily used for smartphones and tablets. This skill involves proficiency in creating, designing, and maintaining applications (apps) that run on the Android platform. It includes understanding programming languages such as Java or Kotlin, knowledge of Android SDK, and familiarity with development tools like Android Studio. Mastering this skill enables developers to build innovative mobile solutions, enhance user experiences, and contribute to the growing app ecosystem.

android_zero_touch_enrollment.name: Android Zero Touch Enrollment
android_zero_touch_enrollment.description: Android Zero Touch Enrollment is a provisioning method that allows IT administrators to deploy Android devices remotely and automatically. It simplifies the setup process by connecting devices to a Mobile Device Management (MDM) solution as soon as they are powered on and connected to Wi-Fi. This skill is essential for organizations looking to streamline device management, enhance security, and reduce the time and effort required for large-scale deployments, ensuring devices are ready for use without manual configuration.

animation.name: Animation
animation.description: Animation involves creating animated content, including videos, GIFs, and interactive presentations, to communicate complex ideas, explain products or services, and engage audiences visually.

annuity_management_techniques.name: Annuity Management Techniques
annuity_management_techniques.description: Annuity Management Techniques is the expertise in handling various aspects of annuity products offered by insurance companies. This includes understanding different types of annuities, such as fixed, variable, and indexed annuities, as well as managing annuity contracts, payments, and beneficiary designations.

ansible.name: Ansible
ansible.description: Open-source automation solution for managing infrastructure and applications

anti_mafia_legislation.name: Anti-Mafia Legislation
anti_mafia_legislation.description: Legal professionals in the insurance industry with expertise in anti-mafia legislation specialize in navigating and ensuring compliance with laws and regulations aimed at combating organized crime and mafia-related activities. They possess in-depth knowledge of anti-money laundering (AML) regulations, counter-terrorism financing (CTF) laws, and other relevant legislation designed to prevent criminal organizations from infiltrating or exploiting insurance operations.

anti_money_laundering_regulations.name: Anti-Money Laundering Regulations
anti_money_laundering_regulations.description: Knowledge of laws, regulations, and protocols aimed at preventing and detecting money laundering activities within financial institutions and other regulated sectors. This skill involves understanding customer due diligence requirements, transaction monitoring, suspicious activity reporting, and compliance with regulatory directives issued by authorities like Financial Action Task Force (FATF) and regulatory bodies in relevant jurisdictions.

anti_virus_management_avm.name: Anti-Virus Management (AVM)
anti_virus_management_avm.description: Anti-Virus Management (AVM) is the process of installing, configuring, maintaining, and monitoring anti-virus software to protect computer systems from malware, viruses, and other cybersecurity threats. This skill involves regularly updating virus definitions, conducting system scans, and responding to potential security breaches. Effective AVM ensures the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of data, reduces the risk of system infections, and enhances overall cybersecurity posture in both personal and organizational settings.

aoms.name: AOMS
aoms.description: Allianz Output Management Service is to automate document generation and work process in Allianz Group and to simplify customer communication for Allianz customers. It provides Allianz OEs following standard document output solutions by using Allianz standard platforms and technologies.

apache_airflow.name: Apache Airflow
apache_airflow.description: Apache Airflow is an open-source workflow management platform for data engineering pipelines

apache_camel.name: Apache Camel
apache_camel.description: Apache Camel is an open source framework for message-oriented middleware with a rule-based routing and mediation engine that provides a Java object-based implementation of the Enterprise Integration Patterns using an application programming interface to configure routing and mediation rules

apache_cassandra.name: Apache Cassandra
apache_cassandra.description: Apache Cassandra is a highly scalable, distributed NoSQL database designed to handle large volumes of data across many servers with no single point of failure. It is used for managing structured data across multiple commodity servers, ensuring high availability and fault tolerance. Cassandra's architecture supports fast write and read operations, making it ideal for applications requiring real-time data access, such as social media platforms, IoT systems, and large-scale analytics.

apache_flink.name: Apache Flink
apache_flink.description: Apache Flink is an open-source, unified stream-processing and batch-processing framework developed by the Apache Software Foundation

apache_hadoop.name: Apache Hadoop
apache_hadoop.description: Apache Hadoop is a collection of open-source software utilities that facilitates using a network of many computers to solve problems involving massive amounts of data and computation. It provides a software framework for distributed storage and processing of big data using the MapReduce programming model

apache_hive.name: Apache Hive
apache_hive.description: Apache Hive is a data warehousing infrastructure built on top of Hadoop, designed for querying and managing large datasets stored in distributed storage. It provides an SQL-like interface to enable users to perform data analysis using a high-level language called HiveQL, making it easier for those familiar with SQL to access and manipulate big data. Hive is widely used for data analysis, reporting, and summarizing large volumes of information in business intelligence and data science applications.

apache_kafka.name: Apache Kafka
apache_kafka.description: Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform used for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications. It enables organizations to publish, subscribe to, store, and process streams of records in a fault-tolerant manner. Kafka is widely used for log aggregation, real-time analytics, and integrating various data systems, allowing for efficient data handling and scalability in environments that require high throughput and low latency.

apache_mxnet.name: Apache MXNet
apache_mxnet.description: Apache MXNet is an open-source deep learning software framework that trains and deploys deep neural networks. It aims to be scalable, allows fast model training, and supports a flexible programming model and multiple programming languages. The MXNet library is portable and can scale to multiple GPUs and machines

apache_spark.name: Apache Spark
apache_spark.description: Apache Spark is an open-source unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing.

apache_web_server_management.name: Apache Web Server Management
apache_web_server_management.description: Apache Web Server monitoring and management platform allows to manage and monitor Apache Web Servers from a single pane of view

apache_zookeeper.name: Apache ZooKeeper
apache_zookeeper.description: Apache ZooKeeper is centralized services for maintaining configuration information, naming and providing distributed synchronization

api_management.name: API Management
api_management.description: API management is the process of creating and publishing web application programming interfaces (APIs), enforcing their usage policies, controlling access.

api_testing.name: API Testing
api_testing.description: API Testing is the process of verifying and validating the functionality, and reliability of application programming interfaces (APIs). It ensures that APIs work as intended and can handle various inputs and expected outputs while maintaining data integrity. This type of testing is crucial for ensuring seamless communication between different software components, thus enhancing the overall quality of software applications.

apigee.name: Apigee
apigee.description: Apigee is a robust API management platform that allows organizations to design, secure, and scale APIs. It facilitates the creation of application programming interfaces (APIs) for applications, enabling seamless communication between different software components. Apigee also provides analytics, security features, and traffic management tools, making it essential for businesses to deliver secure and efficient digital services.

apis_for_web_services_rest_graphql.name: APIs for Web Services (REST, GraphQL)
apis_for_web_services_rest_graphql.description: APIs for Web Services (REST, GraphQL) refers to the knowledge and ability to design, implement, and interact with Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that facilitate communication between web services. REST (Representational State Transfer) provides a structured way to access and manipulate resources through standard HTTP methods, while GraphQL offers a flexible query language to request specific data. These skills are essential for developing modern web applications, enabling seamless data exchange and integration between different systems and services.

apl_allianz_product_laboratory.name: APL (Allianz Product Laboratory)
apl_allianz_product_laboratory.description: APL refers to the specialized framework and tools used by Allianz to design, develop, and enhance insurance and financial products. It focuses on leveraging advanced analytics, product innovation, and customer insights to meet market demands and regulatory requirements. APL is used to streamline product workflows, enhance user experience, and facilitate data-driven decision-making within the organizational ecosystem.

appdynamics.name: AppDynamics
appdynamics.description: App Dynamics is the proficiency in deploying, configuring, and managing the AppDynamics platform within IT infrastructure environments. This includes expertise in setting up monitoring agents, configuring dashboards and alerts, analyzing performance data, troubleshooting issues, and optimizing application performance based on insights provided by the AppDynamics platform.

apple_ios.name: Apple iOS
apple_ios.description: Apple iOS is the mobile operating system created by Apple Inc., designed for iPhones, iPads, and iPod Touch devices. This skill involves understanding the development, design, and functionality of iOS applications, as well as familiarity with Apple's Human Interface Guidelines. Proficiency in iOS enables developers to create user-friendly apps, troubleshoot issues, implement updates, and optimize performance, ensuring an engaging experience for users in the Apple ecosystem.

applicant_tracking_system.name: Applicant Tracking System
applicant_tracking_system.description: An Applicant Tracking System (ATS) is a software application designed to streamline the recruitment process by automating the collection, sorting, and management of job applications. It helps employers efficiently track candidates through various stages of hiring, from application submission to interview scheduling. ATS enhances recruitment efficiency by filtering resumes, facilitating communication, and providing analytics on candidate evaluations, thereby improving the overall quality and speed of hiring decisions.

application_implementation.name: Application Implementation
application_implementation.description: Application implementation is the process of deploying software applications in a technical environment, ensuring they operate effectively and meet user requirements. This skill involves planning, configuring, testing, and maintaining applications to optimize performance and usability. It is used in various industries to facilitate business operations, enhance productivity, and support digital transformation initiatives. Professionals skilled in application implementation collaborate with stakeholders to tailor solutions that align with organizational goals and address specific user needs.

application_of_mathematical_principles.name: Application of Mathematical Principles
application_of_mathematical_principles.description: The skill Application of Mathematical Principles for actuaries involves using mathematical concepts, theories, and methods to analyze and solve problems in actuarial contexts. Actuaries with this skill apply mathematical principles such as calculus, probability theory, statistics, and linear algebra to model and quantify risks, assess financial liabilities, and develop strategies to manage uncertainties in insurance and related industries.

application_packaging.name: Application Packaging
application_packaging.description: Application Packaging is the process of creating a software package that contains all the necessary files, scripts, and configurations needed to install and run an application on a computer system. This skill is crucial for software deployment, ensuring that applications can be efficiently installed, configured, and managed across multiple computers in an organization. Application packaging simplifies the installation process, enhances compatibility, and facilitates easier updates and maintenance, ultimately improving IT efficiency and user experience.

application_programming_interface_api.name: Application Programming Interface (API)
application_programming_interface_api.description: An Application Programming Interface (API) is a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and interact with each other. APIs enable developers to access specific functionalities or data from a service, facilitating integration between various systems, applications, or platforms. They are essential for building software that can utilize third-party services, streamline processes, and enhance the user experience by enabling seamless data exchange and functionality across diverse applications.

application_security.name: Application Security
application_security.description: Application Security refers to the practice of protecting software applications from threats and vulnerabilities throughout their lifecycle. This skill involves identifying, analyzing, and mitigating risks associated with software design and development. Application security encompasses various methodologies, including secure coding practices, security testing, and vulnerability assessments. Professionals in this field work to ensure that applications are resilient against attacks, safeguarding sensitive data and maintaining regulatory compliance, thus enhancing overall organizational security.

application_testing.name: Application Testing
application_testing.description: Application testing is the process of evaluating a software application to identify defects, ensure quality, and verify that it meets specified requirements. It encompasses various methods, including functional testing, performance testing, security testing, and usability testing. Its primary purpose is to ensure that an application performs as intended in various scenarios and under different conditions, ultimately enhancing user satisfaction and reducing the likelihood of failures in production.

applications_architecture.name: Applications Architecture
applications_architecture.description: Architecture of an individual software application

aqua_security.name: Aqua Security
aqua_security.description: Container security platform and cloud-native security solutions

arabic.name: Arabic
arabic.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

arcgis_maps_sdk.name: ArcGIS Maps SDK
arcgis_maps_sdk.description: Developer product for building mapping and spatial analysis for web applications

archer_integrated_risk_management.name: Archer Integrated Risk Management
archer_integrated_risk_management.description: Archer Integrated Risk Management is a comprehensive approach to identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks across an organization. This skill involves utilizing the Archer platform to streamline risk management processes, enhance visibility into potential threats, and ensure compliance with regulations. It is used to support informed decision-making, improve organizational resilience, and align risk strategies with business objectives, thereby fostering a proactive risk culture within the enterprise.

architectural_design.name: Architectural Design
architectural_design.description: Architectural Design pertains to the planning and design of physical spaces within an insurance company's facilities.

ard_claims_settlement.name: ARD Claims Settlement
ard_claims_settlement.description: ARD (Automobile - Related Damage) Claims Settlement pertains to the resolution of insurance claims related to automobile-related damages covered under insurance policies. Claims professionals proficient in ARD claims settlement oversee the assessment, processing, and settlement of claims arising from vehicular accidents, property damage, or liability claims involving automobiles. They investigate the circumstances of accidents, evaluate the extent of damages, verify coverage provisions, and negotiate settlement terms with policyholders or third-party claimants.

arduino.name: Arduino
arduino.description: Arduino is an open-source electronics platform based on easy-to-use hardware and software. It allows users to create interactive projects by programming microcontrollers using the Arduino programming language and IDE. This skill is fundamental for developing prototypes, automating tasks, and integrating sensors and actuators in various applications, ranging from robotics and home automation to art installations and educational projects. It fosters creativity and problem-solving through hands-on learning in electronics and programming.

arista_networks.name: Arista Networks
arista_networks.description: Arista Networks specializes in cloud networking solutions, providing high-performance, scalable, and programmable network switches and software for data centers and large-scale enterprise networks. This skill encompasses knowledge of Arista's platforms, such as their EOS (Extensible Operating System), automation tools, and network management applications. It is essential for professionals involved in designing, implementing, and maintaining advanced networking infrastructures, ensuring reliability, efficiency, and innovation in handling large volumes of data traffic.

artificial_intelligence_ai.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
artificial_intelligence_ai.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems. It encompasses various subfields such as machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics. AI is used to analyze data, make decisions, automate tasks, and enhance user experiences. Its applications range from virtual assistants and recommendation systems to autonomous vehicles and healthcare diagnostics, driving innovation and efficiency across numerous industries.

as_400.name: AS 400
as_400.description: AS/400, now known as IBM iSeries, is a midrange computer system that supports various applications, including databases, web services, and business processes. It utilizes a robust operating system and offers integrated hardware, software, and security features. Professionals skilled in AS/400 typically work in IT environments, maintaining legacy applications, managing databases (such as DB2), and ensuring system performance. This skill is essential for organizations relying on IBM's technology for data processing and enterprise resource management.

asana.name: Asana
asana.description: Asana is a project management and collaboration software designed to help teams organize, track, and manage their work. It enables users to create tasks, assign responsibilities, set deadlines, and communicate within projects, facilitating efficient work processes and project visibility. Asana is used to enhance productivity, improve team collaboration, and streamline workflows, making it easier for organizations to achieve their goals and meet deadlines effectively.

asp_net.name: ASP.Net
asp_net.description: Web framework by Microsoft for building web applications and services using the .NET platform

assamese.name: Assamese
assamese.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

assembler.name: ASSEMBLER
assembler.description: Assembler is a programming skill that involves translating assembly language code, a low-level language closely related to machine code, into executable machine code. This skill is essential for systems programming, embedded systems development, and performance optimization, allowing developers to write programs that interact directly with hardware components. Assemblers facilitate the creation of efficient software by enabling fine control over system resources, making it crucial for tasks requiring speed and resource management.

assertiveness.name: Assertiveness
assertiveness.description: Assertiveness is the skill of expressing one's thoughts, feelings, and needs confidently and respectfully. It involves balancing self-assurance with empathy to communicate effectively and maintain positive relationships.

asset_management.name: Asset Management
asset_management.description: Fundamentals of Asset Management involves understanding the principles and practices of effectively managing assets to optimize their value and performance. Individuals with this skill assess and oversee various types of assets, such as financial securities, real estate, or infrastructure, on behalf of individuals, organizations, or institutions.

assistance.name: Assistance
assistance.description: Fundamentals of Assistance refer to the basic principles and practices involved in providing assistance services to individuals or organizations in times of need or emergency. This skill encompasses understanding the scope of assistance services, which may include roadside assistance, medical assistance, travel assistance, legal assistance, and home assistance, among others. It involves knowledge of the procedures, protocols, and resources required to deliver timely and effective assistance to those in distress or facing challenges.

attributions_and_facts_management_in_the.name: Attributions and Facts Management in the Chart of Accounts
attributions_and_facts_management_in_the.description: Attributions and Facts Management in the Chart of Accounts refers to the ability to manage attributions and facts within the chart of accounts, including defining accounting rules, assigning attributes to accounts, and maintaining accurate records of financial transactions to facilitate reporting and analysis.

audit.name: Audit
audit.description: Audit refers to the ability to understand the principles and practices of auditing within the insurance industry, including regulatory compliance, risk assessment, internal controls, and financial reporting specific to insurance operations.

audit_and_control_of_remittances_from_ag.name: Audit and Control of Remittances from Agencies and Brokers
audit_and_control_of_remittances_from_ag.description: Audit and Control of Remittances from Agencies and Brokers refers to the ability to oversee and evaluate the remittance processes from insurance agencies and brokers, ensuring accuracy, compliance with contractual agreements, and timely reconciliation of premiums, commissions, and other financial transactions.

audit_methodologies.name: Audit Methodologies
audit_methodologies.description: Audit Methodologies refers to the systematic approaches, techniques, and procedures used by auditors to plan, execute, and evaluate audit engagements effectively. Individuals with this skill are proficient in various audit methodologies, such as risk-based auditing, compliance auditing, or performance auditing, tailored to the specific objectives and scope of the audit.

audit_of_balance_sheets_and_related_acco.name: Audit of Balance Sheets and Related Accounts
audit_of_balance_sheets_and_related_acco.description: Audit of Balance Sheets and Related Accounts involves conducting a thorough examination and verification of financial statements, specifically focusing on balance sheets and associated accounts. Individuals with this skill perform audits to assess the accuracy, completeness, and compliance of financial information presented in balance sheets, including assets, liabilities, and equity accounts.

audit_report_preparation.name: Audit Report Preparation
audit_report_preparation.description: Proficiency in preparing comprehensive audit reports that document findings, conclusions, and recommendations resulting from audit procedures. This skill involves effectively communicating audit results, including identifying areas of improvement, control deficiencies, and compliance issues, to stakeholders such as management, regulators, and auditees.

augmented_reality.name: Augmented Reality
augmented_reality.description: Augmented Reality (AR) is an interactive technology that overlays digital information—such as images, videos, or 3D models—onto the real world, enhancing the user's perception of their environment. It is used in various applications, including gaming, education, training, and marketing, allowing users to engage with virtual elements in real-time. AR enhances user experiences, facilitates immersive learning, and offers innovative solutions for problem-solving in diverse fields.

automated_machine_learning.name: Automated Machine Learning
automated_machine_learning.description: Automated Machine Learning encompasses proficiency in utilizing AutoML (Automated Machine Learning) techniques and tools to automate the process of building and deploying machine learning models.

automation_testing___cucumber.name: Automation Testing - Cucumber
automation_testing___cucumber.description: Cucumber is a testing tool that supports Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), allowing teams to write human-readable test cases in plain language. Using Gherkin syntax, testers can define acceptance criteria as executable specifications that bridge communication between technical and non-technical stakeholders. Cucumber automates the testing process, ensuring that software behaves as expected, thus enhancing productivity and reducing manual testing efforts.

automation_testing___karate.name: Automation Testing - Karate
automation_testing___karate.description: Karate is an open-source framework for automated testing, particularly focused on testing web services and APIs. It combines API testing, UI automation, and  using a domain-specific language (DSL) that allows non-programmers to write tests easily. Karate’s feature files facilitate behavior-driven development (BDD), enabling fast and reliable testing process implementation.

automation_testing___scripting.name: Automation Testing - Scripting
automation_testing___scripting.description: Automation Testing - Scripting is the process of writing scripts (using a programming language like Java or automation tools like Selenium, TOSCA etc.) to automate test cases and validate software applications' functionality against the requirmeents. This skill employs programming languages and testing frameworks to create reusable test scripts that can efficiently execute repetitive testing tasks, ensuring consistent results and reducing manual effort. It is essential for improving testing efficiency, accelerating release cycles, and enhancing the overall quality of software products.

automation_testing___selenium.name: Automation Testing - Selenium
automation_testing___selenium.description: Selenium is an open-source, automated testing tool used to test web applications only across various browsers. Automation Testing using Selenium refers to the practice of writing scripts to automate web application testing using the Selenium framework. Selenium supports multiple programming languages and various browsers, enabling testers to simulate user interactions and verify application behavior efficiently. It is widely used for regression testing, ensuring software reliability and facilitating continuous integration and deployment processes.

automation_testing___tosca.name: Automation Testing - TOSCA
automation_testing___tosca.description: Automation Testing using TOSCA involves the use of Tricentis TOSCA - a software tool designed for automated testing of software applications. It enables the creation, management, and execution of automated test cases without extensive programming knowledge. TOSCA supports end-to-end testing, integration testing, and continuous testing within DevOps environments, allowing for efficient regression testing, early bug detection, and improved overall software quality.

automation_testing___uft.name: Automation Testing - UFT
automation_testing___uft.description: Automation Testing using Unified Functional Testing (UFT) involves automating the testing process of software applications to ensure they meet quality standards. UFT is a tool that allows testers to create robust test scripts for functional and regression testing, enabling efficient detection of defects and enhancing test coverage. It uses keyword-driven and scripting methodologies to automate user interface interactions and validate application behavior.

autosys_workload_automation.name: Autosys Workload Automation
autosys_workload_automation.description: Autosys Workload Automation is a job scheduling tool used to automate the execution of various tasks and processes across an IT environment. It enables organizations to manage complex workflows, ensuring timely job execution, resource management, and dependency handling. This skill involves configuring and monitoring job schedules, troubleshooting failures, and optimizing performance, ultimately enhancing operational efficiency and reducing manual intervention in routine tasks. Proficiency in Autosys is essential for ensuring smooth IT business operations.

awadhi.name: Awadhi
awadhi.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

aws_bedrock.name: AWS Bedrock
aws_bedrock.description: AWS Bedrock is a fully managed service that enables developers to build and scale generative AI applications using pre-trained foundation models from various AI providers. It simplifies the process of integrating AI into applications by offering an easy-to-use interface and robust infrastructure. AWS Bedrock is utilized for tasks such as natural language processing, image generation, and content creation, facilitating innovation and accelerating development cycles in AI-driven solutions across different industries.

aws_cloud_formation.name: AWS Cloud Formation
aws_cloud_formation.description: AWS CloudFormation is a service that enables users to automate the deployment and management of cloud resources in Amazon Web Services (AWS). It allows you to create, update, and version infrastructure through code, using templates written in JSON or YAML. This skill is crucial for DevOps practices, enabling consistent infrastructure provisioning, reducing operational overhead, and facilitating collaboration among teams by using infrastructure as code (IaC) principles. It ensures reproducibility and simplifies processes for managing cloud environments.

aws_cloud_operations.name: AWS Cloud Operations
aws_cloud_operations.description: AWS Cloud Operations encompasses the management and maintenance of applications and services running on Amazon Web Services (AWS).
