cisco_unified_border_elements_cube.description: Cisco Unified Border Element (CUBE) performs the four critical functions of a session border controller: session control, security, interworking, and demarcation. Migrate to SIP in a way that works for your business by controlling the pace and strategy.

cisco_unified_communications_manager.name: Cisco Unified Communications Manager
cisco_unified_communications_manager.description: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) is a call-processing and management platform that enables voice, video, messaging, and data communication within organizations. It streamlines communication by integrating various tools like VoIP, video conferencing, and instant messaging into a single system. CUCM enhances collaboration, improves productivity, and reduces operational costs by providing features such as call routing, voicemail, and system administration. It's essential for IT professionals in telecommunications and network management.

cisco_unified_computing_system_ucs.name: Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS)
cisco_unified_computing_system_ucs.description: Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) is a data center platform that integrates compute, networking, storage access, and management into a unified architecture. This skill encompasses the design, deployment, and management of UCS to optimize data center resource utilization and streamline operations. It is used for enhancing scalability, improving operational efficiency, and enabling virtualization in IT environments, making it essential for professionals involved in cloud computing, data center management, and IT infrastructure administration.

cisco_unified_contact_center_enterprise_.name: Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise (UCCE)
cisco_unified_contact_center_enterprise_.description: Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise (UCCE) is a sophisticated, scalable solution used for managing customer interactions across multiple channels, such as voice, email, chat, and social media. It integrates various communication tools to optimize contact center operations, enhance customer experience, and improve agent productivity. UCCE is widely used in large enterprises to streamline workflows, provide real-time analytics, and enable efficient handling of customer inquiries, ultimately driving customer satisfaction and loyalty.

cisco_unified_contact_center_express_ucc.name: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX)
cisco_unified_contact_center_express_ucc.description: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX) is a robust contact center solution that enables organizations to manage customer interactions across multiple channels, including voice, email, and chat. It integrates call routing, reporting, and workforce optimization to enhance customer service and operational efficiency. UCCX is used by businesses to improve customer experience, streamline communication processes, and optimize agent performance, making it essential for effective customer support and engagement strategies.

cisco_unity_connection.name: Cisco Unity Connection
cisco_unity_connection.description: Cisco Unity Connection is a voicemail and unified messaging system that integrates with Cisco's Unified Communications solutions. It allows users to manage voice messages, emails, and faxes from a single interface, enhancing communication efficiency. The skill involves configuring, administering, and troubleshooting the system to ensure reliable message delivery and user accessibility. It is commonly used in businesses to streamline communications and improve collaboration among teams.

cisco_voice_gateways.name: Cisco Voice Gateways
cisco_voice_gateways.description: Cisco Voice Gateways refer to network devices that facilitate the connection between traditional Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) and Voice over IP (VoIP) networks. They convert voice signals into digital data packets for efficient transmission over IP networks, enabling seamless communication. This skill is essential for network engineers and IT professionals who design, implement, and maintain voice communication systems, ensuring high-quality voice calls and integrated telephony solutions within organizations.

cisco_wifiwireless.name: Cisco WIFI/Wireless
cisco_wifiwireless.description: Cisco WiFi/Wireless refers to the expertise in configuring, managing, and troubleshooting wireless networks using Cisco hardware and software solutions. This skill involves understanding wireless standards, access point deployment, security protocols, and network optimization techniques to ensure reliable connectivity and performance. It is essential for IT professionals in environments that rely on wireless technologies, enabling seamless communication and data transfer in businesses, educational institutions, and other organizations. Proficiency in this area enhances network design and user experience.

cisl.name: CISL
cisl.description: The Core Insurance Service Layer (CISL) is a sophisticated, modular software architecture designed to streamline and optimize core insurance operations. It supports various insurance processes, including policy administration, claims processing, billing, underwriting, and customer relationship management (CRM). The CISL technical role focuses on the development, maintenance, and enhancement of this architecture to ensure efficiency, data consistency, and seamless integration with other systems and services.

citrix_netscaler.name: Citrix NetScaler
citrix_netscaler.description: Web application delivery controller (ADC) that can make applications run more efficiently

citrix_provisioning_services.name: Citrix Provisioning Services
citrix_provisioning_services.description: Citrix Provisioning Services (PVS) is a virtualization technology that enables the deployment and management of virtual desktops and servers efficiently. It allows IT administrators to stream a single image of an operating system to multiple devices, ensuring consistency in updates and patches. This skill is essential for optimizing resource utilization, reducing storage costs, and simplifying image management in large-scale enterprise environments, ultimately enhancing user experiences and improving administrative workflows.

citrix_xendesktop.name: Citrix XenDesktop
citrix_xendesktop.description: Citrix XenDesktop is a virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solution that allows users to access a consistent desktop experience across various devices and locations. It enables organizations to deliver Windows applications and desktops securely from a centralized server. This skill is essential for IT professionals managing virtual environments, enhancing remote work capabilities, improving resource allocation, and ensuring data security by centralizing control over desktops and applications.

civil_liability_of_administrators.name: Civil Liability of Administrators
civil_liability_of_administrators.description: Civil Liability of Administrators entails knowledge of the legal responsibilities and potential liabilities of administrators and executives within an organization, ensuring they operate within legal and ethical boundaries.

claims_administration_through_rias.name: Claims Administration through RIAS
claims_administration_through_rias.description: Claims Administration through RIAS refers to having expertise in managing reinsurance claims through Reinsurance and Insurance Administration System (RIAS) or similar software platforms designed for claims handling and administration. This skill involves processing and adjudicating reinsurance claims submitted by ceding insurers, verifying coverage under reinsurance treaties, calculating recoverable amounts, and coordinating claim settlements between the ceding insurer and the reinsurer.

claims_division_at_insurers.name: Claims Division at Insurers
claims_division_at_insurers.description: The claims division at insurers is a critical department responsible for managing and processing insurance claims submitted by policyholders. This skill involves understanding the functions, processes, and best practices associated with claims handling within an insurance company. It encompasses knowledge of claims intake, assessment, investigation, adjudication, and settlement processes across different lines of insurance, such as property and casualty, life, health, and liability insurance.

claims_information_system.name: Claims Information System
claims_information_system.description: Claims Information System pertains to the understanding and utilization of specialized information systems designed to manage and process insurance claims efficiently.

claims_investigation.name: Claims Investigation
claims_investigation.description: Claims Investigation is the process of gathering and analyzing information to evaluate the validity, scope, and circumstances surrounding insurance claims.

claims_liquidity_monitoring.name: Claims Liquidity Monitoring
claims_liquidity_monitoring.description: Claims Liquidity Monitoring is having proficiency in monitoring and managing the liquidity risks associated with insurance claims within the risk management division. This skill involves tracking the timing and magnitude of claim payments relative to available liquid assets and cash flows to ensure adequate reserves and liquidity to meet claim obligations.

claims_management.name: Claims Management
claims_management.description: Claims Management is having knowledge and experience with applying claims management processes and procedures.

claims_processing.name: Claims Processing
claims_processing.description: Fundamentals of Claims Processing encompasses the foundational knowledge and techniques required to effectively process insurance claims within an organization.

claims_reporting_and_management_through_.name: Claims Reporting and Management through Direct Channels
claims_reporting_and_management_through_.description: Claims Reporting and Management through Direct Channels involves the efficient handling and resolution of insurance claims through direct communication channels, such as online portals, mobile apps, or self-service platforms. Claims handlers proficient in this area leverage digital technologies and automated systems to streamline the claims reporting and management process, enabling policyholders to report claims, track claim status, and submit required documentation conveniently and securely.

claims_systems.name: Claims Systems
claims_systems.description: Claims Systems refer to the technologies and processes used to manage, process, and administer insurance claims efficiently. These systems facilitate the tracking of claims from submission through resolution, ensuring compliance with regulations and enhancing customer service. Claims Systems are essential for insurers to automate workflows, reduce processing times, and optimize decision-making, ultimately improving operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.

clarity.name: Clarity
clarity.description: Proficiency in utilizing the Clarity software for project management, resource allocation, and financial tracking within IT applications. This skill involves expertise in configuring, customizing, and administering Clarity to facilitate effective project planning, execution, and reporting, ensuring clarity and transparency in project activities and resource utilization.

client_management.name: Client Management
client_management.description: Proficiency in managing relationships with clients within the sales division to ensure satisfaction, retention, and loyalty. This skill includes providing personalized support, addressing client concerns or issues promptly, delivering value-added services, and proactively identifying opportunities to upsell or cross-sell additional insurance products or services based on clients' evolving needs.

cloud_architecture.name: Cloud Architecture
cloud_architecture.description: Cloud Architecture: Cloud architecture refers to the design and structure of cloud computing systems and services. It encompasses the components, modules, and relationships that define how cloud services operate, including storage, networking, and security. This skill is crucial for creating scalable, reliable, and efficient cloud solutions, optimizing resource usage, and ensuring seamless integration of applications in cloud environments. Professionals in this field enable businesses to leverage cloud technologies for enhanced flexibility and reduced infrastructure costs.

cloud_computing.name: Cloud Computing
cloud_computing.description: Cloud Computing is the delivery of on-demand computing services over the internet, including storage, processing power, and software applications. It allows individuals and organizations to access and manage resources remotely, facilitating collaboration, scalability, and cost-efficiency. By utilizing cloud services, users can deploy applications quickly, reduce IT overhead, and ensure data availability and security without the need for extensive physical infrastructure. This skill is essential for businesses to innovate and adapt to changing technological landscapes.

cloud_cost_optimization.name: Cloud Cost Optimization
cloud_cost_optimization.description: Cloud Cost Optimization refers to the practice of managing and reducing expenses associated with cloud computing resources. This skill involves analyzing usage patterns, selecting appropriate pricing models, and implementing strategies to improve efficiency while minimizing waste. It is used to ensure organizations maximize the value of their cloud investments, control budgets, and enhance financial performance, enabling them to allocate resources more effectively and support scalability without incurring unnecessary costs.

cloud_database_administration.name: Cloud Database Administration
cloud_database_administration.description: Cloud Database Administration involves managing and maintaining databases hosted in cloud environments. This skill encompasses tasks such as database design, performance tuning, backup and recovery, security management, and scaling resources to meet demand. Cloud Database Administrators ensure data integrity, availability, and security while optimizing costs. They utilize cloud services like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud to deploy databases, monitor performance, and implement best practices for cloud-based data solutions, enabling organizations to leverage data effectively and efficiently.

cloud_foundry.name: Cloud Foundry
cloud_foundry.description: Open-source platform designed to simplify and streamline the process of building, deploying, and managing applications

cloud_managed_networking.name: Cloud Managed Networking
cloud_managed_networking.description: Cloud-managed networking is the process of managing a company’s network resources using cloud-based technology. This process includes configuring network connections and services, monitoring network health, and providing secure remote access to corporate networks. Cloud-managed networking allows organizations to take advantage of a highly reliable network infrastructure with a flexible, cost-effective approach. Cloud-managed networking is often used in hybrid cloud environments, where some elements are hosted on-premises or in a private cloud, and others through a public cloud provider. It can also be used in multi-site networks, allowing for better control and visibility of the entire network across multiple locations. The cloud-managed networking approach allows organizations to manage their networks more efficiently, as well as with more control and less manual intervention. Cloud-managed networking can provide a secure, resilient network platform, while helping to reduce IT costs, improve network performance, and reduce the complexity of network management.

cloud_network_management.name: Cloud Network Management
cloud_network_management.description: Cloud Network Management is the process of overseeing and optimizing network resources and services that are hosted in a cloud environment. This skill involves configuring, monitoring, and maintaining virtual networks, ensuring data security, performance, and connectivity across cloud platforms. It is used to enhance efficiency, facilitate scalability, and enable seamless communication between cloud-based applications and on-premises systems, ultimately supporting organizations in achieving their operational objectives and improving overall IT governance.

cloud_security.name: Cloud Security
cloud_security.description: Cloud Security refers to the set of policies, technologies, and controls designed to protect data, applications, and infrastructures involved in cloud computing. This skill encompasses risk management, regulatory compliance, identity and access management, and data encryption, among others. It is essential for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of cloud-based resources, mitigating vulnerabilities, and safeguarding sensitive information from cyber threats and unauthorized access in increasingly digital environments.

cloud_service_platforms.name: Cloud Service Platforms
cloud_service_platforms.description: Cloud Service Platforms refer to internet-based services that provide computing resources, storage, and applications on demand. These platforms allow businesses and individuals to access and use technology without the need for physical hardware, facilitating scalability, flexibility, and efficiency. Commonly used for hosting applications, data storage, and collaborative tools, they enable organizations to innovate rapidly, reduce costs, and enhance productivity while ensuring secure and reliable access to their data and services from anywhere.

cloud_technology.name: Cloud Technology
cloud_technology.description: Cloud Technology refers to the delivery of computing services over the internet, including storage, databases, servers, networking, software, and analytics. It enables organizations to access and manage resources on-demand, allowing for scalability, flexibility, and cost-efficiency. Cloud technology supports collaboration and remote work by providing tools and services that enhance productivity and streamline operations. It is used in various applications, from data backup and recovery to application hosting and big data processing.

cloud_native_continuous_integration_cian.name: Cloud-native Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD)
cloud_native_continuous_integration_cian.description: Cloud-native Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) are methodologies that automate the software development process in cloud environments. CI involves the frequent merging of code changes into a shared repository, enabling early detection of errors. CD extends this by automating the deployment of applications to production, ensuring that updates are delivered swiftly and reliably. Together, they enhance collaboration, reduce release cycles, and improve software quality, making it easier for teams to innovate and respond to user demands.

clusteredgeneral_parallel_file_system_cp.name: Clustered/General Parallel File System (CPFS/GPFS)
clusteredgeneral_parallel_file_system_cp.description: Clustered/General Parallel File Systemis the expertise in deploying and managing CPFS/GPFS, a high-performance clustered file system designed for distributed storage environments. This skill involves configuring, optimizing, and maintaining CPFS/GPFS to ensure efficient data access, scalability, and reliability in storage infrastructure.

coaching.name: Coaching
coaching.description: Coaching is the ability to guide, inspire, and support individuals or teams to develop their abilities and achieve their potential. This involves active listening, effective communication, and the ability to provide constructive feedback. It also includes the understanding and ability to use various coaching approaches in various situations.

cobol.name: COBOL
cobol.description: COBOL (Common Business-Oriented Language) is a high-level programming language primarily used for business, finance, and administrative systems for companies and governments. Designed for ease of use and readability, COBOL facilitates processing large volumes of data and transactional tasks. Its enduring presence in legacy systems highlights its importance in data manipulation, reporting, and batch processing. Proficiency in COBOL enables professionals to maintain and upgrade existing systems, ensuring continued operational efficiency in various industries.

codacy.name: Codacy
codacy.description: Platform that helps developers build clean, secure code

codelgniter.name: Codelgniter
codelgniter.description: Proficiency in utilizing CodeIgniter, a powerful PHP framework, for developing web applications. This skill involves expertise in leveraging CodeIgniter's MVC architecture, libraries, and helpers to streamline the development process and create scalable and maintainable code. Additionally, it includes knowledge of CodeIgniter's features such as routing, database abstraction, form validation, and session management to build robust and efficient web applications.

coding_and_hacking.name: Coding and Hacking
coding_and_hacking.description: Coding refers to the process of writing instructions for computers using programming languages, enabling the creation of software, applications, and systems. Hacking involves identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities within computer systems for various purposes, including security testing or ethical hacking, which aims to improve system defenses. Together, these skills are essential for developing technology solutions, enhancing cybersecurity, and understanding how systems operate, making them valuable in tech industries and security analysis.

cofense_phishme.name: Cofense Phishme
cofense_phishme.description: Cofense Phishme is a security awareness training tool designed to educate employees about phishing threats and improve their ability to recognize and respond to phishing attempts. This skill involves understanding various phishing tactics, identifying suspicious emails and links, and implementing best practices to mitigate risks. It is used to enhance organizational security by fostering a culture of vigilance and reducing the likelihood of successful cyberattacks through employee engagement and awareness.

cognigy_ai.name: Cognigy AI
cognigy_ai.description: Cognigy AI is a conversational AI platform that enables organizations to create, deploy, and manage intelligent virtual agents or chatbots. This skill focuses on integrating natural language processing and machine learning to enhance customer interactions across various channels like websites, messaging apps, and voice platforms. It is used for automating customer support, improving user engagement, and providing real-time assistance, ultimately streamlining communication and enhancing the user experience.

cognigy_ai_bot_development.name: Cognigy AI Bot Development
cognigy_ai_bot_development.description: Cognigy AI Bot Development involves creating and deploying conversational agents using the Cognigy.AI platform. This skill focuses on designing intelligent chatbots and virtual assistants that enhance customer interactions through natural language processing (NLP). It includes building workflows, integrating APIs, and utilizing machine learning to provide personalized responses. This skill is essential for improving customer service, streamlining operations, and enhancing user experiences in various applications like websites, messaging apps, and customer support systems.

cognigy_ai_foundation.name: Cognigy AI Foundation
cognigy_ai_foundation.description: Cognigy AI Foundation is a conversational AI skill that enables users to develop and manage automated customer interactions through natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. This skill is used to create intelligent chatbots and virtual agents that can understand and respond to customer inquiries across various channels. It enhances user engagement, improves customer service efficiency, and allows businesses to automate routine tasks, ultimately leading to improved customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

cognitive_aiops.name: Cognitive AIOPS
cognitive_aiops.description: Cognitive AIOPS refers to a specialized branch of AIOps that incorporates cognitive computing techniques, such as NLP and sentiment analysis, to further enhance IT operations automation. This skill involves expertise in deploying advanced AI algorithms to analyze unstructured data, understand human language, and derive actionable insights for optimizing IT performance and resolving issues efficiently.

cognitive_automation_ipcenter.name: Cognitive Automation Ipcenter
cognitive_automation_ipcenter.description: Cognitive Automation (IPCenter) : Cognitive Automation is the integration of advanced technologies, such as artificial intelligence and machine learning, to enhance business processes and decision-making. Specifically within IPCenter, it automates repetitive tasks, analyzes large data sets, and predicts outcomes to improve operational efficiency. This skill is essential for organizations seeking to streamline workflows, reduce manual effort, and leverage data-driven insights for better strategic planning and resource allocation.

cognitive_bots.name: Cognitive Bots
cognitive_bots.description: Cognitive Bots refers to the ability to develop and deploy cognitive bots, which are AI-powered chatbots equipped with natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning capabilities. This skill involves expertise in designing conversational interfaces, training bot models with relevant data, and integrating them into data ecosystems to provide intelligent and context-aware interactions for data-related inquiries and tasks.

cognitive_computing.name: Cognitive Computing
cognitive_computing.description: Cognitive computing refers to technologies that enable machines to simulate human thought processes, utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning. This skill involves processing and analyzing large volumes of data to derive insights, understand natural language, and make decisions. It is used in various applications such as virtual assistants, customer service automation, and data analysis, helping organizations improve efficiency, enhance decision-making, and provide personalized experiences in real-time.

coheris.name: Coheris
coheris.description: Customer Relationship Management, Customer Insight and Analytics solutions

collaboration.name: Collaboration
collaboration.description: Collaboration refers to the ability to work cooperatively with others to achieve common goals, leveraging diverse perspectives and skills.

collaborative_leadership.name: Collaborative Leadership
collaborative_leadership.description: Collaborative Leadership is the ability to lead by encouraging teamwork, shared decision-making, and open communication to achieve common goals.

collection_and_disbursement.name: Collection and Disbursement
collection_and_disbursement.description: Collection and Disbursement involve understanding the essential principles and practices related to the management of financial transactions within an organization. In the context of insurance, this skill encompasses knowledge of the processes and procedures for collecting premiums from policyholders and disbursing payments for claims, expenses, and other financial obligations. It includes familiarity with billing systems, payment methods, reconciliation processes, and regulatory requirements governing financial transactions in the insurance industry.

collective_and_individual_life_product_c.name: Collective and Individual Life Product Catalog
collective_and_individual_life_product_c.description: Collective and Individual Life Product Catalog pertains to the development, maintenance, and management of a comprehensive catalog of collective and individual life insurance products offered by an insurance company. It includes defining product specifications, features, pricing structures, terms and conditions, underwriting guidelines, and regulatory compliance requirements for each life insurance product in the catalog.

commercial_actions_development_programmi.name: Commercial Actions Development, Programming and Monitoring
commercial_actions_development_programmi.description: Commercial Actions Development, Programming, and Monitoring entails conceptualizing, planning, implementing, and evaluating commercial initiatives and promotional activities to attract, retain, and engage customers in the insurance market.

commissioning_of_financial_providers.name: Commissioning of Financial Providers
commissioning_of_financial_providers.description: Commissioning of Financial Providers entails selecting, evaluating, and managing financial service providers to ensure they meet the company's needs and comply with regulatory requirements.

commissions.name: Commissions
commissions.description: Commissions refer to the compensation paid to insurance agents, brokers, or intermediaries for selling insurance policies or bringing in new clients to an insurance company. This skill involves understanding the structure, calculation, and administration of commissions within the insurance industry.

communication.name: Communication
communication.description: Communication is the ability to convey information effectively and clearly to others through verbal, written, or non-verbal means.

communication_strategy.name: Communication Strategy
communication_strategy.description: Communication Strategy involves developing and implementing plans to effectively convey messages to target audiences. It encompasses identifying communication goals, defining key messages, selecting appropriate communication channels, and establishing tactics to reach stakeholders.

communication_techniques_for_audit.name: Communication Techniques for Audit
communication_techniques_for_audit.description: Communication Techniques for Audit refers to employing effective communication techniques, including active listening, questioning, and report writing, to convey audit findings, recommendations, and conclusions clearly and persuasively to stakeholders, both verbally and in written reports.

community_management.name: Community Management
community_management.description: Community Management focuses on building and managing online communities of customers, prospects, and stakeholders to foster engagement, loyalty, and brand advocacy for an insurance company.

commvault.name: Commvault
commvault.description: Commvault is a comprehensive data management and protection software solution that enables organizations to efficiently backup, recover, and manage their data across various environments, including on-premises and cloud. It is used for safeguarding critical information, ensuring compliance, and facilitating data recovery during disruptions. With features like deduplication, automated workflows, and flexible storage options, Commvault helps streamline data management processes and optimizes storage utilization, enhancing overall operational efficiency and data integrity.

commvault_administration.name: Commvault Administration
commvault_administration.description: Commvault Administration is the practice of managing and configuring Commvault software, which is designed for data backup, recovery, and management. This skill involves tasks such as setting up data protection policies, monitoring backup processes, and ensuring data integrity. Professionals in this role optimize storage resources, implement disaster recovery solutions, and handle troubleshooting to maintain efficient data workflows across various environments. Commvault Administration is essential for organizations to safeguard critical information and ensure quick recovery during data loss events.

company_data.name: Company Data
company_data.description: Basic Knowledge of Company Data refers to the understanding of fundamental information about the organization, including its structure, operations, products, services, and key performance indicators.

company_tax_and_bankruptcy_law.name: Company, Tax, and Bankruptcy Law
company_tax_and_bankruptcy_law.description: Proficiency in company, tax, and bankruptcy law encompasses a deep understanding of the legal frameworks governing corporate operations, taxation, and insolvency matters.

compensation_management.name: Compensation Management
compensation_management.description: Compensation Management involves designing and administering pay structures to reward employees fairly and competitively. It includes analyzing market trends, evaluating job roles, and aligning compensation with performance and organizational goals.

competition_law.name: Competition Law
competition_law.description: Expertise in competition law, also known as antitrust law, involves knowledge of regulations and statutes aimed at promoting fair competition, preventing anti-competitive practices, and safeguarding consumer welfare in the marketplace.

complaints_management.name: Complaints Management
complaints_management.description: Knowledge of how complaints are managed and the processes that apply.

compliance.name: Compliance
compliance.description: Compliance encompasses a broad understanding of regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies relevant to an organization's operations. Compliance professionals ensure that the organization adheres to applicable laws, regulations, and standards by developing and implementing compliance programs, policies, and procedures. They monitor regulatory developments, assess compliance risks, conduct audits and reviews, and provide training and guidance to employees to promote a culture of compliance.

compliance_management.name: Compliance Management
compliance_management.description: Compliance Management involves overseeing and ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies within an organization. Compliance managers develop and implement strategies, policies, and procedures to mitigate risks related to non-compliance with laws and regulations. They monitor regulatory changes, conduct risk assessments, and collaborate with various departments to establish and maintain compliance frameworks.

compliance_requirements.name: Compliance Requirements
compliance_requirements.description: Compliance Requirements focuses on understanding and interpreting regulatory mandates and requirements relevant to an organization's operations. Compliance professionals analyze laws, regulations, and industry guidelines applicable to their industry and business activities. They identify key compliance obligations, assess their impact on business operations, and develop processes and controls to ensure adherence.

compliance_review.name: Compliance Review
compliance_review.description: Compliance Review involves conducting assessments and evaluations to determine the effectiveness of compliance programs and controls within an organization. Compliance reviewers assess adherence to regulatory requirements, internal policies, and industry standards by examining documentation, conducting interviews, and performing testing procedures. They identify gaps or deficiencies in compliance processes and recommend corrective actions to enhance compliance effectiveness and mitigate risks.

computer_forensics.name: Computer Forensics
computer_forensics.description: Investigation of data stored on cuomputers, servers and other digital storage media

computer_hardware.name: Computer Hardware
computer_hardware.description: Application of PC and server hardware knowledge to provide IT support.

computer_network_management.name: Computer Network Management
computer_network_management.description: Computer Network Management involves the administration, maintenance, and optimization of computer networks to ensure efficient operation and communication within an organization. This skill encompasses monitoring network performance, troubleshooting issues, configuring network devices, and implementing security measures. It is essential for maintaining connectivity, enhancing data transmission, and safeguarding sensitive information, thereby ensuring that all networked systems function smoothly and securely to support business objectives.

computer_vision.name: Computer Vision
computer_vision.description: Computer Vision is a field of artificial intelligence that enables computers to interpret and process visual information from the world. It involves the use of algorithms and models to analyze images and videos for tasks such as object recognition, image classification, and motion detection. Applications include autonomous vehicles, facial recognition, augmented reality, and medical image analysis, transforming how machines perceive and interact with visual data to aid in decision-making and automation.

computer_vision_algorithms.name: Computer Vision Algorithms
computer_vision_algorithms.description: Computer vision algorithms are computational methods that enable machines to interpret and understand visual information from the world. They analyze and process images or video data to identify objects, detect patterns, and make decisions based on visual input. Common applications include facial recognition, autonomous vehicles, and medical image analysis. This skill is essential in fields such as artificial intelligence, robotics, and surveillance, facilitating the development of systems that can 'see' and act intelligently.

concept_development.name: Concept Development
concept_development.description: Concept Development refers to the process of creating and refining new ideas and solutions, moving them from initial concept to actionable plans.

conceptual_thinking.name: Conceptual Thinking
conceptual_thinking.description: Conceptual Thinking refers to the ability to understand complex ideas and systems by recognizing patterns, relationships, and underlying principles.

confidentiality.name: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: Confidentiality involves protecting sensitive information from unauthorized access or disclosure. It requires understanding privacy principles, implementing security measures, and adhering to ethical and legal standards to maintain trust and integrity.

config_suite.name: Config Suite
config_suite.description: Config Suite is a software development tool that simplifies configuration management for large projects. It offers centralized control, version tracking, dependency management, validation, and role-based access. With seamless integration into existing workflows, it enhances productivity, reliability, and agility in software development and deployment.

configuration_management_database_cmdb_a.name: Configuration Management Database (CMDB) and Universal Discovery (UD)
configuration_management_database_cmdb_a.description: Configuration Management Database (CMDB) and Universal Discovery (UD) : A CMDB is a centralized repository that stores information about IT assets, their configurations, and relationships, enabling organizations to manage and optimize their IT infrastructure. Universal Discovery is a tool that automates the identification and mapping of IT components across environments, feeding accurate data into the CMDB. Together, they support effective change management, incident resolution, and overall IT service management by ensuring that stakeholders have up-to-date and reliable information.

conflict_management.name: Conflict Management
conflict_management.description: Conflict Management is the ability to identify and handle conflicts sensibly, fairly, and efficiently.

conflict_resolution.name: Conflict Resolution
conflict_resolution.description: Conflict Resolution refers to the process of resolving disputes and disagreements in a constructive manner, ensuring positive outcomes for all parties involved.

confluence.name: Confluence
confluence.description: Confluence is the expertise in configuring Confluence spaces, creating and editing pages, managing permissions, and integrating with other Atlassian tools such as Jira for streamlined project management and collaboration.

construction_and_operation_of_expense_bu.name: Construction and Operation of Expense Budget
construction_and_operation_of_expense_bu.description: Construction and Operation of Expense Budget involves the creation and management of expense budgets, which outline planned expenditures and allocate financial resources for various operational activities within an organization. It includes identifying and categorizing different types of expenses, estimating their costs based on historical data and future projections, setting budgetary targets, and monitoring actual expenditures against budgeted amounts.

consuming_data_service_from_on_premise__.name: Consuming data service from on-premise / CPI
consuming_data_service_from_on_premise__.description: Consuming data service from on-premise / CPI is the process of connecting to an on-premise or cloud-based data service through an application programming interface (API) to access and utilize the data stored in the service. The data can be structured or unstructured and can be accessed through a web-based GUI, command-line interface, or by custom-built applications. This skill also allows for the integration of data from various sources and the conversion of data into the required format for consumption. The ability to consume data service from on-premise / CPI requires a deep understanding of the source data and the methods for consuming and manipulating the data. This skill involves the ability to develop and maintain custom applications, the ability to troubleshoot any connectivity issues and the knowledge to determine the best way to use the data.

contact_center_calling.name: Contact Center Calling
contact_center_calling.description: A Contact Center Calling is a business skill which is used to manage customer communications from different media types such as telephone, web chat, email, or social media. It is responsible for managing the communications between a company and its customers. The purpose of this skill is to provide customers with the most efficient and satisfying experience possible. This skill also includes tracking customer interactions, identifying customer needs, and delivering quality services that meet customer’s expectations. Contact center calling requires strong customer service skills, strong attention to detail, good knowledge of customer service policies and procedures, and excellent problem-solving abilities. Additionally, the contact center calling skill must have the ability to coordinate multiple customer interactions simultaneously, as the contact center may handle hundreds of interactions per day. This skill must continually adapt to changing customer trends in order to remain competitive in the marketplace.

contact_management_techniques.name: Contact Management Techniques
contact_management_techniques.description: Contact Management Techniques are the skills and tools used to maintain and organize relationships with key stakeholders and customers.

containerization.name: Containerization
containerization.description: Containerization is operating system-level virtualization or application-level virtualization over multiple network resources so that software applications can run in isolated user spaces called containers in any cloud or non-cloud environment, regardless of type or vendor.

content_creation.name: Content Creation
content_creation.description: Content Creation is the ability to create engaging content that can be used across various channels to communicate with a target audience.

content_curation.name: Content Curation
content_curation.description: Content Curation entails sourcing, selecting, and organizing relevant third-party content from various sources to supplement and enrich an insurance company's content marketing efforts.

content_delivery_network_cdn.name: Content Delivery Network (CDN)
content_delivery_network_cdn.description: Geographically distributed group of servers that caches content close to end users

content_development.name: Content Development
content_development.description: Fundamentals of Content Development involves understanding the principles and best practices of content creation, including writing, editing, graphic design, and multimedia production.

content_development_for_social_media.name: Content Development for Social Media
content_development_for_social_media.description: Content Development for Social Media focuses on creating compelling and shareable content specifically tailored for social media platforms to drive engagement, increase brand awareness, and foster community interaction.

content_management_systems.name: Content Management Systems
content_management_systems.description: Content Management Systems is the ability to use content management systems and creation tools.

content_marketing.name: Content Marketing
content_marketing.description: Content Marketing involves creating and distributing valuable, relevant, and consistent content to attract and engage a defined target audience and drive profitable customer action.

content_writing.name: Content Writing
content_writing.description: Content Writing involves crafting engaging and persuasive written content tailored to meet the needs and interests of the target audience.

continuous_architecture.name: Continuous Architecture
continuous_architecture.description: Continuous Architecture is an approach to software design that integrates architectural practices into the ongoing development process. It emphasizes the ability to adapt and evolve the architecture of a system in response to changing requirements, technologies, and user feedback. This skill enables teams to deliver high-quality, maintainable software by fostering collaboration between architects and developers, ensuring that architecture remains relevant throughout the software lifecycle. It is crucial for agile environments and supports innovation and scalability.

continuous_delivery_cd.name: Continuous Delivery (CD)
continuous_delivery_cd.description: Continuous Delivery (CD) is a software development practice that emphasizes the automated deployment of code changes to production at any time. This skill involves the use of tools and processes to ensure that software is always in a releasable state, enabling teams to quickly deliver updates, bug fixes, and new features. CD enhances collaboration, reduces the risk of deployment failures, and accelerates feedback cycles, ultimately improving product quality and meeting customer demands efficiently.

continuous_integration_ci.name: Continuous Integration (CI)
continuous_integration_ci.description: Continuous Integration (CI) is a software development practice where code changes are automatically tested and merged into a shared repository frequently, often multiple times a day. This skill involves using tools and pipelines to facilitate automated building, testing, and deployment of applications. CI aims to detect and address integration issues early, improve code quality, and enhance collaboration among development teams, ultimately accelerating the software delivery process and ensuring a more reliable product.

contract_administration.name: Contract Administration
contract_administration.description: Contract Administration involves overseeing and managing the administrative aspects of insurance contracts throughout their lifecycle. It includes activities such as policy issuance, premium billing, endorsements, renewals, cancellations, and other policy-related transactions.

contract_analysis.name: Contract Analysis
contract_analysis.description: Contract Analysis involves analyzing insurance contracts to assess their terms, conditions, coverage limits, exclusions, and other key provisions.

contract_drafting.name: Contract Drafting
contract_drafting.description: Contract Drafting involves drafting insurance contracts, policy documents, and related legal agreements according to established guidelines, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.

contract_management.name: Contract Management
contract_management.description: Contract Management involves managing the entire lifecycle of insurance contracts, from initiation to termination, to ensure compliance, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

contracting_of_externals.name: Contracting of Externals
contracting_of_externals.description: Contracting of Externals involves engaging external service providers, vendors, consultants, or third-party administrators to support various functions within the policy management division.

contractor_management.name: Contractor Management
contractor_management.description: Ability to effectively manage and work with contractors

contrast_security.name: Contrast Security
contrast_security.description: Contrast Security involves using application security tools that provide real-time, in-context protection by embedding security directly into the software development lifecycle. This skill focuses on identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities within applications as they are being developed, rather than after deployment. It enables developers to fix security issues proactively, ensuring robust application security and compliance while reducing risks of breaches. This skill is essential for organizations looking to enhance their cybersecurity posture in today’s threat landscape.

control_hub.name: Control Hub
control_hub.description: Control center for managing and optimizing collaboration services (e.g. Webex)

control_objectives_for_information_and_r.name: Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology (COBIT)
control_objectives_for_information_and_r.description: Definition of Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies. Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies, more popularly known as COBIT, is a framework that aims to help organizations that are looking to develop, implement, monitor, and improve IT governance and information management.

conversational_ai.name: Conversational AI
conversational_ai.description: Conversational AI refers to technologies that enable machines to understand, process, and respond to human language in a natural, interactive way. This skill is used to create chatbots, virtual assistants, and voice-activated systems that facilitate seamless communication between users and digital platforms. It enhances customer service, automates repetitive tasks, and improves user engagement by providing instant, context-aware responses, making it essential for businesses aiming to improve customer experiences and operational efficiency.

cooperation.name: Cooperation
cooperation.description: Cooperation refers to the ability to work harmoniously with others, combining efforts and resources to achieve shared objectives.

copyright_infringements.name: Copyright Infringements
copyright_infringements.description: Legal professionals specializing in copyright law within the insurance industry are knowledgeable about the legal framework governing intellectual property rights. They handle cases involving copyright infringements, ensuring that insurers comply with copyright laws when using or distributing copyrighted materials. This includes assessing potential copyright risks, drafting licensing agreements, enforcing copyright protection measures, and resolving disputes related to copyright infringement allegations.

corda.name: Corda
corda.description: Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) designed for businesses, particularly financial institutions. It serves as a shared ledger for transactions, eliminating the need for constant reconciliation between parties after interacting with each other

corporate_acts_balance_sheet_and_extraor.name: Corporate Acts Balance Sheet and Extraordinary Operations
corporate_acts_balance_sheet_and_extraor.description: Corporate Acts Balance Sheet and Extraordinary Operations refers to the having the understanding of accounting principles and procedures related to corporate transactions, balance sheet adjustments, and extraordinary events. This skill involves analyzing financial statements to ensure accurate recording of corporate actions, such as mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, and restructuring activities, and their impact on the balance sheet and financial performance for Auditors.

corporate_affair_regulatory_management.name: Corporate Affair Regulatory Management
corporate_affair_regulatory_management.description: Corporate Affair Regulatory Management proficiency and expertise

corporate_and_specialty_as_line_of_busin.name: Corporate and Specialty as Line of Business
corporate_and_specialty_as_line_of_busin.description: Corporate and Specialty Insurance is a specialized line of insurance that provides coverage for unique, complex, or high-value risks faced by corporations, businesses, and organizations. This skill involves understanding the fundamentals of corporate and specialty insurance products, markets, and underwriting practices.

corporate_branding.name: Corporate Branding
corporate_branding.description: Corporate Branding involves developing and managing the overall brand identity and reputation of an insurance company in the marketplace.

corporate_communications.name: Corporate Communications
corporate_communications.description: Corporate Communication involves managing the flow of information within and outside an organization to convey its values, goals, and activities. It encompasses various communication activities, including internal communications to employees, external communications to customers, investors, and the public, and crisis communication to address issues or challenges.

corporate_customer_portfolio_development.name: Corporate Customer Portfolio Development
corporate_customer_portfolio_development.description: Corporate Customer Portfolio Development focuses on expanding and managing the portfolio of corporate clients and the marketing-specific communication.

corporate_governance.name: Corporate Governance
corporate_governance.description: Basics of Corporate Governance refers to the system of rules, practices, and processes by which companies are directed and controlled. This skill encompasses understanding the roles and responsibilities of boards of directors, executive management, and shareholders in overseeing and guiding the organization's activities. Basics of corporate governance include principles of transparency, accountability, and integrity, as well as compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.

corporate_law.name: Corporate Law
corporate_law.description: Proficiency in corporate law involves a comprehensive understanding of the legal principles and regulations governing corporate entities.

corporate_security.name: Corporate Security
corporate_security.description: Expertise in corporate security encompasses knowledge of strategies, policies, and practices aimed at safeguarding an insurer's assets, information, and operations from internal and external threats.

corporate_services_system.name: Corporate Services System
corporate_services_system.description: This skill involves the ability to effectively utilize corporate services systems to manage various administrative and support functions within an organization. It includes understanding the software's features for tasks such as employee onboarding, benefits administration, expense management, time tracking, and facilities management.

corporate_social_responsibility.name: Corporate Social Responsibility
corporate_social_responsibility.description: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) refers to a company's voluntary initiatives to assess and take responsibility for its impact on society and the environment. This skill involves integrating social, environmental, and ethical concerns into business operations and interactions with stakeholders. It encompasses initiatives to improve workplace diversity and inclusion, reduce environmental footprint, support local communities, and uphold ethical business practices throughout the value chain.

corporate_sustainability_reporting_direc.name: Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive
corporate_sustainability_reporting_direc.description: The Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive is a European Union initiative aimed at enhancing corporate transparency and accountability regarding sustainability matters. This skill involves understanding the requirements and guidelines outlined in the CSRD, which mandate companies to report on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) aspects of their operations.

corporate_tax.name: Corporate Tax
corporate_tax.description: Corporate taxation refers to the system of levying taxes on the profits earned by corporations or businesses. It involves understanding and complying with tax laws, regulations, and reporting requirements related to corporate income tax, deductions, credits, and exemptions. Proficiency in corporate taxation enables finance professionals to ensure tax compliance, minimize tax liabilities through effective tax planning strategies, and optimize the tax efficiency of corporate structures and transactions.

correspondence_and_transparency_in_group.name: Correspondence and Transparency in Group Financial Statements Preparation
correspondence_and_transparency_in_group.description: Correspondence and Transparency in Group Financial Statements Preparation is the skill of preparing group financial statements with a focus on ensuring correspondence and transparency between individual entity financials and consolidated statements. This involves reconciling intercompany transactions, eliminating intra-group balances, and providing clear disclosures to stakeholders.

coso.name: Coso
coso.description: Framework is a foundation of modern internal controls and fraud deterrence.

cost_accounting.name: Cost Accounting
cost_accounting.description: Cost Accounting involves the process of recording, analyzing, and reporting on the costs associated with producing goods or services within an organization. It aims to provide insights into the cost structure of products or services, identify areas for cost reduction or efficiency improvement, and support decision-making processes related to pricing, budgeting, and resource allocation.

cost_management.name: Cost Management
cost_management.description: Cost Management involves the process of planning, controlling, and optimizing costs within an organization to achieve strategic objectives and maximize profitability. It includes activities such as cost estimation, cost control, cost reduction, and cost analysis across various functions and activities of the organization.

creative_cloud_specialist.name: Creative Cloud Specialist
creative_cloud_specialist.description: A Creative Cloud Specialist utilizes Adobe Creative Cloud applications such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and Premiere Pro. This role involves using these tools for graphic design, video editing, web development, and digital content creation. Creative Cloud Specialists leverage their expertise to develop visually appealing materials, enhance brand identity, and produce engaging multimedia projects. Their skills are essential in industries like marketing, advertising, and media, where creativity and technical knowledge are crucial for successful communication and storytelling.

creative_thinking.name: Creative Thinking
creative_thinking.description: Creative Thinking is that ability to generate, develop, and express unique and original ideas or solutions that are valuable and meaningful. It involves thinking outside the box, challenging conventional wisdom, and imagining new ways of doing things.

creativity.name: Creativity
creativity.description: Creativity is the ability to tap into the imagination and generate original ideas.

crisis_management.name: Crisis Management
crisis_management.description: Crisis Management refers to the strategic planning, coordination, and execution of actions to effectively mitigate, respond to, and recover from crises or emergencies that threaten the stability, reputation, or operations of an organization.

crisp_dm_cross_industry_standard_process.name: CRISP_DM (Cross Industry Standard Process for Data Mining)
crisp_dm_cross_industry_standard_process.description: CRISP-DM (Cross Industry Standard Process for Data Mining) is a structured framework used for data mining projects. It outlines a systematic process consisting of six phases: Business Understanding, Data Understanding, Data Preparation, Modeling, Evaluation, and Deployment. This methodology helps teams effectively navigate the complexities of data analysis, ensuring that insights are aligned with business objectives. CRISP-DM promotes collaboration and iterative refinement throughout the project, making it a versatile tool applicable across various industries.

critical_thinking.name: Critical Thinking
critical_thinking.description: Critical Thinking is the ability to objectively analyze and evaluate an issue or situation in order to form a judgment. It involves the use of analysis, synthesis, inference, and evaluation. Critical thinking requires questioning assumptions, identifying biases, considering different perspectives, and seeking evidence to support conclusions. It also includes the ability to identify the relevance and importance of ideas, and to understand the logical connections between them.

crm_databases.name: CRM Databases
crm_databases.description: Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) databases and their basic functionalities within the sales division. This skill includes understanding how to use CRM systems to store and manage customer data, track interactions and transactions, and generate insights to support sales strategies and decision-making processes.

cross_border.name: Cross Border
cross_border.description: Cross-border e-commerce is the buying and selling of goods or services across international borders. It involves the transfer of products or services from one country to another, often with the use of online marketplaces or e-commerce platforms. Cross-border e-commerce is an important part of the global economy and is an area that’s continuing to grow. It can be a lucrative business for both sellers and buyers, as it allows for a greater range of products and services to be available to more customers. Cross-border e-commerce requires an understanding of different markets, languages, cultural norms, and currencies, as well as a good knowledge of shipping and customs regulations. Additionally, online payment processing systems, product tracking and return processing, and customer service must also be taken into account.

cross_device_uxui_design.name: Cross-Device UX/UI Design
cross_device_uxui_design.description: Cross-Device UX/UI Design is the skill of creating user experiences and interfaces that function seamlessly across various devices, such as smartphones, tablets, laptops, and desktops. It involves understanding different screen sizes, resolutions, and input methods to ensure a consistent and intuitive user experience. This skill is essential for designers aiming to enhance accessibility and user satisfaction, as it allows applications and websites to adapt fluidly to diverse platforms, ultimately improving usability and engagement.

cross_functional_capability.name: Cross-Functional Capability
cross_functional_capability.description: Cross-Functional Capability is the ability to work effectively with all levels of management and across departments.

crossplane.name: Crossplane
crossplane.description: Crossplane is an open-source infrastructure as code tool that enables users to manage cloud resources across multiple providers using Kubernetes APIs. It allows developers to define, provision, and manage resources declaratively. By utilizing Crossplane, organizations can create consistent and repeatable cloud environments, enhancing DevOps workflows and resource management. This skill is particularly useful for teams seeking to implement cloud-native practices and improve the efficiency of their infrastructure management processes.

crowdstrike_falcon.name: CrowdStrike Falcon
crowdstrike_falcon.description: Comprehensive platform designed to provide robust security across various domains, including endpoints, cloud workloads, identities, and data

csr_requirements_corporate_social_respon.name: CSR Requirements (Corporate Social Responsibility)
csr_requirements_corporate_social_respon.description: CSR Requirements (Corporate Social Responsibility) proficiency and expertise

cultural_awareness.name: Cultural Awareness
cultural_awareness.description: Cultural Awareness refers to the understanding and appreciation of cultural differences, allowing individuals to interact effectively and respectfully in diverse environments.

cultural_competence.name: Cultural Competence
cultural_competence.description: Cultural Competence is the awareness of one’s own cultural worldview, knowledge of different cultural practices and worldviews, and inclusive attitude towards cultural differences.

cultural_intelligence.name: Cultural Intelligence
cultural_intelligence.description: Cultural Intelligence refers to the ability to recognize, understand, and adapt to different cultural contexts and behaviors, enabling effective interaction and communication with individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds. It involves awareness, knowledge, and skills to navigate cultural differences and foster inclusive relationships.

culture.name: Culture
culture.description: Culture is a shared pattern of beliefs, values, assumptions and behaviors that distinguish one group from another.

curiosity.name: Curiosity
curiosity.description: Curiosity refers to the desire to explore and learn, promoting creativity and adaptability. It encourages questioning and discovery, embracing new technologies, approaches and perspectives, leading to a deeper understanding of the workplace and to innovation.

cusp.name: CUSP
cusp.description: CUSP consists of a network layer and a payment orchestration layer. The network layer is a series of smart IOT devices very similar to soundboxes with the capability to provide unique location ID inside a store, contactless data transfer, proximity detection, and support conversational inputs.

customer_centric_mindset.name: Customer Centric Mindset
customer_centric_mindset.description: A Customer Centric Mindset is the foundation of an organization's approach to conducting business, focusing on meeting and exceeding the needs and expectations of customers. This skill involves developing a deep understanding of customer preferences, behaviors, and pain points to tailor products, services, and experiences accordingly. It encompasses prioritizing customer satisfaction, building strong relationships, and delivering value at every touchpoint along the customer journey.

customer_centricity.name: Customer Centricity
customer_centricity.description: Customer Centricity is the ability to consistently prioritize and deliver on the needs and expectations of customers in order to enhance their experience and satisfaction. This involves understanding and empathizing with customers, effectively communicating with them, and providing personalized service or solutions. It also includes the ability to use customer feedback and data to make informed decisions and improvements.

customer_communication.name: Customer Communication
customer_communication.description: Customer Communication involves effectively conveying information, messages, and value propositions to customers through various channels and touchpoints. This skill encompasses verbal, written, and non-verbal communication techniques aimed at engaging, informing, and persuading customers. It includes active listening to understand customer inquiries and concerns, clear and concise articulation of product features and benefits, and empathetic communication to address customer issues and build rapport.

customer_excellence.name: Customer Excellence
customer_excellence.description: Customer Excellence refers to the overarching commitment to delivering exceptional value, satisfaction, and experiences to customers throughout their interactions with a product, service, or organization.

customer_experience.name: Customer Experience
customer_experience.description: Customer Experience refers to the overall perception and sentiment of customers based on their interactions with a brand, product, or service across various touchpoints and channels.

customer_focus.name: Customer Focus
customer_focus.description: Customer Focus puts the customer experience at the heart of all decisions and strategies.  Identifies closely with customers and acts as a voice for customers internally.  Uses in-depth knowledge of the customer to identify opportunities to introduce new solutions to address customer needs, drivers, pain points and strategic objectives.  Anticipates how customer requirements and trends may change over time, and feeds market knowledge to inform the design of market-relevant solutions and products.

customer_information_control_system_cics.name: Customer Information Control System (CICS)
customer_information_control_system_cics.description: IBM middleware of mixed-language application server for online transaction processing

customer_journey_mapping.name: Customer Journey Mapping
customer_journey_mapping.description: Customer Journey Mapping is the ability to create a graphical representation of a customer's journey through their lifecycle, as a means of identifying potential improvements.

customer_journeys.name: Customer Journeys
customer_journeys.description: People with this skill design products/services with a customer centric perspective: they are able to build the customer journey and understand the customer's needs

customer_needs_analysis.name: Customer Needs Analysis
customer_needs_analysis.description: Customer Needs Analysis involves systematically identifying, evaluating, and understanding the requirements, preferences, and pain points of customers. This skill requires the ability to gather and analyze data through various methods such as surveys, interviews, and market research to gain insights into customer behavior and expectations. It involves assessing both explicit and implicit needs, anticipating future trends, and identifying opportunities to address unmet customer needs.

customer_orientation.name: Customer Orientation
customer_orientation.description: Customer Orientation is the ability to always understand and service internal and external customers. It involves being proactive in improving customer experience, creating best practice and understanding the unexpressed needs of the client

customer_profitability_analysis.name: Customer Profitability Analysis
customer_profitability_analysis.description: Customer Profitability Analysis is the proficiency of evaluating the profitability of individual customers or client segments within the underwriting context. This skill involves assessing the revenue generated from insurance premiums paid by customers against the costs associated with underwriting, servicing, and handling claims for their policies. Underwriters analyze various factors such as premium volume, loss ratios, administrative expenses, and customer retention rates to determine the net profitability of each customer relationship.

customer_protection.name: Customer Protection
customer_protection.description: Customer Protection involves safeguarding the rights, interests, and well-being of customers throughout their interactions with a company. This skill encompasses implementing policies, procedures, and measures to ensure fair treatment, transparency, and privacy for customers. It involves compliance with regulations and industry standards related to consumer rights, data protection, and financial security. Customer Protection also entails providing clear and accurate information about products and services, resolving customer complaints and disputes promptly, and preventing fraud and abuse.

customer_segmentation.name: Customer Segmentation
customer_segmentation.description: Customer Segmentation is having the knowledge of Allianz customer segments and profiles.

customer_service.name: Customer Service
customer_service.description: Customer Service involves the provision of assistance, support, and solutions to customers before, during, and after their interactions with a product, service, or organization.

cyber_laws.name: Cyber Laws
cyber_laws.description: Cyber Laws refer to the legal frameworks and regulations governing the use of the internet, digital communication, and online activities. These laws address issues such as data protection, intellectual property rights, cybercrimes, and privacy. Understanding cyber laws is essential for protecting personal and organizational information, ensuring compliance with legal standards, and navigating disputes involving online behavior. This skill is crucial for legal professionals, businesses, and individuals engaging in digital environments.

cyber_risk_management.name: Cyber Risk Management
cyber_risk_management.description: Cyber Risk Management is the process of identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with information technology and digital assets. This skill involves evaluating potential threats to an organization’s data and systems, implementing security measures, and developing response plans to manage incidents. Cyber Risk Management is essential for protecting sensitive information, ensuring compliance with regulations, and maintaining business continuity in the face of cyber threats. It enables organizations to make informed decisions regarding their cyber security strategies.

cyber_security.name: Cyber Security
cyber_security.description: Cyber Security refers to the practice of protecting systems, networks, and data from digital attacks, theft, and damage. It encompasses a variety of measures, including software, hardware, and processes designed to guard against unauthorized access, exploitation, and risks. Cyber Security is essential for safeguarding sensitive information and ensuring the integrity and availability of technology infrastructures, making it crucial for organizations to maintain operational continuity and protect against financial and reputational loss from cyber threats.

cyber_security_standards.name: Cyber Security Standards
cyber_security_standards.description: Cyber Security Standards refer to a set of guidelines, best practices, and regulatory requirements designed to protect information systems from cyber threats. These standards help organizations establish security frameworks, assess risks, and implement controls to safeguard sensitive data. They are used to create a secure environment that minimizes vulnerabilities, ensures compliance with legal obligations, and fosters trust among stakeholders. Typical standards include ISO/IEC 27001, NIST SP 800-53, and PCI DSS, applicable across various industries.

cyber_threat_analysis.name: Cyber Threat Analysis
cyber_threat_analysis.description: Cyber Threat Analysis is the process of identifying, assessing, and mitigating potential cyber threats to an organization’s information systems. This skill involves analyzing data from various sources to detect vulnerabilities, understanding tactics used by cyber adversaries, and predicting potential attacks. It is crucial for developing effective cybersecurity strategies, enhancing incident response capabilities, and ensuring data protection. Professionals in this field leverage analytical tools and frameworks to safeguard digital assets and maintain organizational resilience against cyber threats.

cyber_threat_intelligence.name: Cyber Threat Intelligence
cyber_threat_intelligence.description: Cyber Threat Intelligence is the process of collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data about potential or existing cyber threats to an organization. This skill involves understanding the tactics, techniques, and procedures employed by cyber adversaries, enabling organizations to proactively identify vulnerabilities, improve defenses, and respond effectively to incidents. By leveraging threat intelligence, businesses can enhance their security posture, reduce risks, and make informed decisions regarding cybersecurity strategies and resource allocation.

cyber_threat_modelling.name: Cyber Threat Modelling
cyber_threat_modelling.description: Cyber Threat Modeling is the process of identifying, analyzing, and prioritizing potential cybersecurity threats to an organization’s information systems. It involves creating representations of potential attackers, their motives, and attack vectors to assess vulnerabilities and risks. This proactive skill is used to enhance security measures, inform incident response strategies, and allocate resources effectively by understanding the threat landscape, ultimately strengthening an organization’s defenses against cyber attacks.

cyberark.name: Cyberark
cyberark.description: CyberArk is a leading privileged access management (PAM) solution, for securing and managing privileged credentials and secrets within data environments. This skill involves expertise in deploying CyberArk's solutions, configuring access controls, monitoring privileged access activities, and ensuring compliance with data security regulations and policies.

cybersecurity_governance.name: Cybersecurity Governance
cybersecurity_governance.description: Cybersecurity Governance is the ability to create and/or apply information security strategies and frameworks to protect the organisation

czech.name: Czech
czech.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

dalle.name: DALLE
dalle.description: DALLE (DALL-E) is an AI model developed by OpenAI, for generating images from textual descriptions. This skill involves expertise in working with large-scale deep learning models, fine-tuning them for specific tasks, and integrating them into data pipelines for generating images based on textual inputs.

damage_assessment_and_appraisal_methods_.name: Damage Assessment and Appraisal Methods and Tools
damage_assessment_and_appraisal_methods_.description: Damage Assessment and Appraisal Methods and Tools entails proficiency in assessing and appraising damages incurred by insured parties due to covered events. Claims professionals with expertise in this area utilize various methods and tools to accurately evaluate the extent of property damage, bodily injuries, or other losses claimed by policyholders.

damage_settlement_resulting_from_rco_rc.name: Damage Settlement Resulting from RCO RC
damage_settlement_resulting_from_rco_rc.description: Damage Settlement Resulting from RCO RC skill involves the process of settling insurance claims resulting from RCO RC (Recoverable Corporate Operations, Reinsurance Contracts). Claims professionals specializing in this area manage the assessment, negotiation, and resolution of claims related to recoverable corporate operations covered under reinsurance contracts. They evaluate the circumstances leading to the claim, verify coverage terms, and negotiate settlement agreements with reinsurers or other involved parties.

darktrace.name: Darktrace
darktrace.description: Darktrace is an AI-driven cybersecurity platform that utilizes machine learning to detect and respond to cyber threats in real-time.
