storage_networking.description: This skill entails designing, implementing, and managing networks specifically optimized for data storage, allowing multiple storage devices to communicate and share data efficiently. It involves configuring storage protocols such as Fibre Channel (FC), iSCSI, and Network Attached Storage (NAS), ensuring high availability and fault tolerance, and optimizing network performance for storage traffic.

storage_virtualization.name: Storage Virtualization
storage_virtualization.description: This skill entails abstracting physical storage resources and presenting them as virtualized storage pools, decoupled from underlying hardware. It involves deploying storage virtualization solutions such as software-defined storage (SDS) or storage virtualization appliances, managing virtual storage resources dynamically, and improving storage efficiency, flexibility, and scalability across heterogeneous storage environments.

storyboarding.name: Storyboarding
storyboarding.description: Storyboarding is a technique used in the pre-production phase of film, animation, or multimedia projects to visually outline and sequence the key scenes or shots. It involves creating a series of sketches or illustrations that represent the flow of the narrative, camera angles, and visual elements. This skill involves: Creating visual storyboards using digital drawing software or traditional sketching techniques, translating script or story outlines into visual sequences that convey the narrative flow and pacing, collaborating with directors, producers, and creative teams to refine storyboard designs and align with project goals, incorporating feedback and revisions to improve clarity and coherence of the visual storytelling, and presenting storyboards to stakeholders for review and approval before production begins.

storylining.name: Storylining
storylining.description: Storylining refers to the process of crafting a clear and compelling narrative to communicate complex information in a structured and engaging way.

storytelling.name: Storytelling
storytelling.description: Ability to create a narrative to effectively communicate a message to the audience.

strategic_orientation.name: Strategic Orientation
strategic_orientation.description: Strategic Orientation refers to the ability to think and act strategically, focusing on long-term goals, objectives, and outcomes.

strategic_planning.name: Strategic Planning
strategic_planning.description: Strategic Planning involves the process of setting long-term goals and objectives and developing comprehensive strategies to achieve them.

strategic_thinking.name: Strategic Thinking
strategic_thinking.description: Strategic Thinking is an ability to plan for the future. It's the capacity to prepare strategies and conjure ideas that will both cope with changing environments and consider the various challenges that lie ahead.

strategic_vision.name: Strategic Vision
strategic_vision.description: Strategic Vision is the ability to define a long-term direction and goals for an organization. It involves anticipating future trends, setting priorities, and inspiring stakeholders to work towards a shared purpose and sustainable success.

strategic_workforce_planning.name: Strategic Workforce Planning
strategic_workforce_planning.description: Knowledge of processes that enable the business to proactively anticipate future talent needs and put plans in place to address them.

strategies_and_tools_to_perform_large_sc.name: Strategies and Tools to Perform Large-Scale Migrations
strategies_and_tools_to_perform_large_sc.description: This skill entails planning, executing, and managing large-scale migrations of data, applications, or infrastructure components across IT environments. It involves developing migration strategies and methodologies, assessing migration risks and dependencies, selecting appropriate migration tools and automation solutions, conducting pilot migrations, and ensuring minimal disruption and downtime during the migration process.

stress_tolerance_and_management.name: Stress Tolerance and Management
stress_tolerance_and_management.description: Stress Tolerance and Management is the ability to remain calm, composed, and effective in high-pressure or stressful environments while managing emotional and physical well-being.

substantive_law.name: Substantive Law
substantive_law.description: Substantive law is the set of laws that governs how members of a society are to behave. It is contrasted with procedural law, which is the set of procedures for making, administering, and enforcing substantive law.

successfactors_learning_management_syste.name: SuccessFactors Learning Management System
successfactors_learning_management_syste.description: The SuccessFactors Learning Management System (LMS) is a cloud-based platform designed to streamline the administration, delivery, and tracking of employee training and development programs. This skill involves knowledge of navigating the LMS interface, creating and managing learning content, monitoring learner progress, and generating reports. It is used by organizations to enhance employee skills, ensure compliance, and foster continuous learning by providing accessible and engaging training resources tailored to individual and organizational needs.

succession_planning.name: Succession Planning
succession_planning.description: Knowledge of processes used to identify and develop talent to fill critical roles in the future.

sunbird_dcim.name: Sunbird DCIM
sunbird_dcim.description: This skill entails using Sunbird Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) software to monitor, manage, and optimize data center infrastructure assets and operations. It involves visualizing and analyzing data center resources such as power, cooling, space, and connectivity, tracking asset inventory and performance metrics, automating routine tasks, and making informed decisions to maximize efficiency and reliability.

sundanese.name: Sundanese
sundanese.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

supplier_relationship_management.name: Supplier Relationship Management
supplier_relationship_management.description: Supplier Relationship Management involves cultivating and managing relationships with suppliers to ensure strategic alignment, quality assurance, and value creation.

survey_research.name: Survey Research
survey_research.description: Survey Research involves collecting and analyzing data from a sample of individuals to gain insights into opinions, behaviors, or characteristics. It uses structured questionnaires and statistical techniques to inform decision-making and policy development.

sustainability.name: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Sustainability refers to the ability to meet the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. This skill encompasses integrating economic, social, and environmental considerations into decision-making processes to achieve long-term viability and resilience.

sustainability_management.name: Sustainability Management
sustainability_management.description: Fundamentals of Sustainability Management involves the strategic planning, implementation, and monitoring of initiatives to address environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues within an organization. This skill encompasses understanding sustainability principles, frameworks, and best practices to integrate sustainability into business strategy and operations effectively. It involves setting sustainability goals, establishing performance metrics, and tracking progress toward environmental and social objectives.

svelte.name: Svelte
svelte.description: Web framework shifting work out of the browser and into the build step

swagger.name: Swagger
swagger.description: This skill entails using Swagger, an open-source framework, to design, document, and test RESTful APIs. It involves defining API specifications using the OpenAPI Specification (formerly known as Swagger Specification), generating interactive API documentation, and facilitating API consumption by developers through code generation, client SDKs, and testing tools.

swedish.name: Swedish
swedish.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

swift.name: Swift
swift.description: Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language developed by Apple for building applications on iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS. It combines modern programming concepts with performance, safety, and ease of use, making it ideal for both beginners and experienced developers. Swift supports protocol-oriented programming and boasts a clean syntax, enabling developers to create responsive and robust applications efficiently.

switches.name: Switches
switches.description: This skill involves understanding and configuring network switches, which are devices used to connect multiple devices within a local area network (LAN) and facilitate communication by forwarding data packets between them based on their MAC addresses. It includes configuring switch ports, VLANs (Virtual Local Area Networks), trunking, and implementing security features to ensure efficient and secure network operations.

switching.name: Switching
switching.description: This skill involves the process of forwarding data packets between network segments or devices within a computer network. It includes understanding different switching techniques such as store-and-forward, cut-through, and fragment-free, as well as configuring and managing switching devices like switches and routers to optimize network performance, reliability, and security.

sybase.name: Sybase
sybase.description: This skill involves working with Sybase, a relational database management system (RDBMS) that provides high-performance and scalable database solutions for enterprises. It includes database administration tasks such as installation, configuration, backup and recovery, performance tuning, and troubleshooting of Sybase databases to ensure data integrity, availability, and optimal performance.

sylheti.name: Sylheti
sylheti.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

symantec_endpoint_protection.name: Symantec Endpoint Protection
symantec_endpoint_protection.description: Symantec Endpoint Protection is a cybersecurity software designed to protect endpoints—such as computers and mobile devices—from malware, viruses, and other security threats. It combines antivirus, antispyware, firewall, and intrusion prevention technologies to secure organizational networks. This skill involves understanding how to deploy, configure, and manage the software to ensure robust protection, monitor threats in real-time, and respond to security incidents effectively, thus maintaining the integrity of sensitive data and systems within an organization.

synapse.name: Synapse
synapse.description: This skill involves using Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics, a cloud-based analytics service that combines enterprise data warehousing and Big Data analytics capabilities into a single platform. It includes data integration, preparation, exploration, and analysis tasks using Synapse Studio, as well as building and deploying machine learning models, and deriving actionable insights from large volumes of structured and unstructured data.

synthesis.name: Synthesis
synthesis.description: Synthesis is the ability to qickly identify the main points and priority even in complexity situation.

system_and_network_configuration.name: System and Network Configuration
system_and_network_configuration.description: This skill involves configuring and optimizing system and network settings to ensure smooth and efficient operation of IT infrastructure. It includes setting up network devices such as routers, switches, and firewalls, configuring IP addresses, subnetting, routing protocols, and Quality of Service (QoS) parameters, as well as optimizing system parameters, services, and resources for performance and scalability.

system_architecture_design.name: System Architecture Design
system_architecture_design.description: System Architecture Design proficiency and expertise

system_configuration_control.name: System Configuration Control
system_configuration_control.description: System Configuration Control is the process of managing and maintaining consistent and accurate settings within hardware and software systems. It involves monitoring, documenting, and adjusting configuration settings to ensure optimal performance, security, and compliance. This skill is essential for IT professionals to prevent configuration drift, facilitate troubleshooting, and support efficient change management in complex environments. Effective system configuration control enhances system reliability and operational efficiency while minimizing risks related to unauthorized changes.

system_configuration_management.name: System Configuration Management
system_configuration_management.description: System Configuration Management is the discipline of systematically managing, organizing, and maintaining the settings and configurations of software and hardware systems. It ensures consistency, reliability, and security across IT environments. This skill is vital for tracking changes, automating deployments, and managing system performance, helping organizations maintain optimal operations while minimizing downtime and disruptions. Effective configuration management leads to streamlined processes, better resource allocation, and enhanced overall system integrity.

system_configuration_tooling.name: System Configuration Tooling
system_configuration_tooling.description: System Configuration Tooling refers to the use of specialized software and tools designed to manage and automate the setup, maintenance, and optimization of computer systems and networks. This skill involves understanding configurations, orchestrating system settings, and implementing best practices to ensure functionality and performance. It is essential for IT professionals to streamline operations, minimize errors, and efficiently deploy resources in environments ranging from servers to cloud infrastructures.

system_development_lifecycle.name: System Development Lifecycle
system_development_lifecycle.description: This skill involves understanding and implementing the various phases of the Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC), which is a process used to design, develop, deploy, and maintain software systems. It includes requirements gathering, system analysis, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance, following industry best practices and methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, and DevOps.

system_integration.name: System Integration
system_integration.description: System integration combines different subsystems or components into a cohesive and functional whole. This skill involves ensuring that various software applications, hardware, and networks communicate effectively to work together seamlessly. System integration is critical in optimizing operational efficiency, enhancing data sharing, and improving overall system performance in various fields, including IT, manufacturing, and telecommunications. It also helps organizations streamline processes and reduce redundancy by creating a unified technology environment.

system_integration_testing.name: System Integration Testing
system_integration_testing.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in evaluating and validating various components of an organization's IT infrastructure to ensure they meet performance, reliability, security, and scalability requirements.

system_related_continuous_development.name: System-related Continuous Development
system_related_continuous_development.description: System-related Continuous Development refers to the ongoing process of enhancing and optimizing systems within an organization through iterative improvements. This skill involves analyzing system performance, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing changes to enhance efficiency, functionality, and user experience. It is used to ensure that systems remain adaptable and responsive to evolving business needs, technological advancements, and user feedback, ultimately driving innovation and maintaining competitiveness in the market.

systems_architecture.name: Systems Architecture
systems_architecture.description: Architecture of entire ecosystem including hardware, software, networks etc.

systems_behavior.name: Systems Behavior
systems_behavior.description: Systems Behavior refers to the study of how different components of a system interact and influence one another over time. This skill involves analyzing patterns, feedback loops, and the dynamics of complex systems—whether in business, ecology, or social networks. Understanding systems behavior helps in predicting outcomes, optimizing performance, and improving decision-making by addressing the interconnectedness and interdependencies within systems. It is essential for problem-solving and designing interventions effectively in various fields.

systems_performance_engineering.name: Systems Performance Engineering
systems_performance_engineering.description: Performance engineering involves the systematic approach to designing, building, and optimizing the performance of software systems and applications. It encompasses various activities such as performance testing, profiling, tuning, and monitoring to ensure that applications meet their performance requirements under expected workloads. Proficiency in performance engineering involves skills in analyzing system architecture, identifying performance bottlenecks, optimizing code and configurations, conducting load testing and stress testing, measuring system response times, and implementing scalability solutions.

systems_thinking.name: Systems Thinking
systems_thinking.description: Systems Thinking is an analytical approach that considers the interrelationships and interactions within complex systems. It involves understanding how components influence one another and using this insight to solve problems and make decisions holistically.

tableau.name: Tableau
tableau.description: Tableau is a powerful data visualization tool used for converting raw data into interactive and shareable dashboards. It allows users to analyze data trends, patterns, and insights through a user-friendly interface, making complex data accessible. Tableau is widely used in business intelligence for decision-making, reporting, and data storytelling, enabling organizations to visualize key performance indicators and track progress effectively. It supports various data sources and equips users with the ability to collaborate and share findings easily.

tactic_procurement_and_vendor_due_dilige.name: Tactic Procurement and Vendor Due Diligence
tactic_procurement_and_vendor_due_dilige.description: Tactic Procurement and Vendor Due Diligence encompasses tactical procurement strategies and due diligence processes for vendor selection and contracting.

tagalog.name: Tagalog
tagalog.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

talend.name: Talend
talend.description: Talend is an open-source data integration platform that allows users to connect, access, and manage data across various systems and platforms. This skill involves: Designing, developing, and implementing data integration solutions using Talend Studio, including ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, data migration, and data synchronization tasks.

talent_acquisition.name: Talent Acquisition
talent_acquisition.description: Talent Acquisition is the process of attracting, recruiting, and hiring skilled individuals to meet organizational needs. It involves developing strategies to source, assess, and onboard candidates who align with company values and objectives.

talent_assessment.name: Talent Assessment
talent_assessment.description: Talent Assessment involves evaluating individuals' skills, abilities, and potential to determine their suitability for specific roles or development programs.

talent_development.name: Talent Development
talent_development.description: Talent Development is the approach to enhancing employees' skills and competencies to align with organizational goals. It involves providing training, mentoring, and growth opportunities to prepare individuals for current and future roles.

talent_experience_building.name: Talent Experience Building
talent_experience_building.description: Talent Experience Building focuses on creating positive and enriching experiences for employees throughout their career lifecycle. It involves developing initiatives that enhance engagement, satisfaction, and retention by addressing career development, work-life balance, and organizational culture.

talent_management.name: Talent Management
talent_management.description: Understands the full scope of HR processes to attract, onboard, develop, motivate, and retain high-performing employees. Uses this knowledge to develop strategies that help the business achieve it's goals.

tamil.name: Tamil
tamil.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

targeted_messaging.name: Targeted Messaging
targeted_messaging.description: Targeted Messaging entails crafting tailored and personalized communication campaigns to effectively engage specific audience segments and achieve marketing objectives.

tariff_systems_for_single_and_fleet_cove.name: Tariff Systems for Single and Fleet Coverage
tariff_systems_for_single_and_fleet_cove.description: Tariff Systems for Single and Fleet Coverage involves proficiency in designing and managing tariff systems for both single and fleet coverage within the insurance products division of insurers. It includes developing pricing structures, rate tables, and underwriting guidelines for various types of insurance policies, such as auto insurance, property insurance, and liability insurance. Tariff systems for single and fleet coverage aim to accurately assess the risks associated with insuring individual vehicles or groups of vehicles, ensuring fair and competitive premiums while maintaining profitability for the insurer.

tax_analysis.name: Tax Analysis
tax_analysis.description: Tax Analysis involves evaluating the tax implications of various financial decisions, transactions, or scenarios. It includes assessing the tax consequences of investments, mergers and acquisitions, restructuring activities, international transactions, and other business activities. Proficiency in tax analysis enables finance professionals to identify tax planning opportunities, mitigate tax risks, and optimize tax outcomes to enhance overall financial performance and minimize tax liabilities.

taxation.name: Taxation
taxation.description: Taxation encompasses the broader field of levying and collecting taxes imposed by governments on individuals, businesses, or other entities. It includes understanding various types of taxes such as income tax, property tax, corporate tax, capital gains tax, and estate tax, among others. Proficiency in taxation involves knowledge of tax laws, regulations, compliance requirements, and strategies to manage tax obligations efficiently while maximizing tax benefits and minimizing tax risks.

taxation_of_capital_income.name: Taxation of Capital Income
taxation_of_capital_income.description: Taxation of Capital Income involves understanding and managing the taxation aspects related to capital income, which includes income generated from investments such as dividends, interest, capital gains, and other forms of investment returns.

team_building.name: Team Building
team_building.description: Team building is a collective term for various types of activities used to enhance social relations and define roles within teams, often involving collaborative tasks.

team_foundation_server.name: Team Foundation Server
team_foundation_server.description: TFS is a Microsoft product that provides version control, agile planning, continuous integration, and other collaboration tools for software development teams. This skill involves: Setting up and configuring TFS environments, managing version control repositories, creating and tracking work items, automating build and release processes, and facilitating collaboration among team members.

team_management.name: Team Management
team_management.description: Team Management refers to the ability to lead, coordinate, and motivate a group of individuals to work together effectively to achieve shared goals.

teamwork.name: Teamwork
teamwork.description: Ability to work as part of a team to achieve a common goal or to complete a task.

technical_debt_management.name: Technical Debt Management
technical_debt_management.description: Handling trade-offs between quick solutions and effective, long-term solutions in software development

technical_documentation.name: Technical Documentation
technical_documentation.description: Ability to create documents that explain the use, functionality or architecture of a product, process or system.

technical_support___1st_line.name: Technical Support - 1st Line
technical_support___1st_line.description: Technical support provided at the first level of contact with customers, typically involving basic troubleshooting and issue resolution. This skill involves: Responding to customer inquiries, diagnosing basic technical problems, providing initial support and guidance, and escalating complex issues to higher-level support teams when necessary.

technical_support___2nd_line.name: Technical Support - 2nd Line
technical_support___2nd_line.description: Technical support provided at the second level of contact with customers, involving more in-depth troubleshooting and problem resolution compared to 1st line support. This skill involves: Handling escalated technical issues from 1st line support, performing advanced troubleshooting, analyzing system logs, and providing detailed resolutions to customers or escalating to 3rd line support if needed.

technical_writing_and_modelling_uml.name: Technical Writing and Modelling (UML)
technical_writing_and_modelling_uml.description: Technical Writing and Modelling (UML) in the insurance industry involve creating detailed documentation and mathematical models to describe, analyze, and communicate complex insurance concepts, processes, and methodologies. This skill encompasses writing technical reports, policy documents, actuarial memoranda, and model documentation using clear and concise language tailored to the intended audience.

techniques_and_methods_for_software_desi.name: Techniques and Methods for Software Design
techniques_and_methods_for_software_desi.description: Techniques and Methods for Software Design encompass a variety of principles, strategies, and frameworks used to create effective and efficient software solutions. This skill involves understanding design patterns, architectural styles, and best practices that facilitate the development process. It is utilized to ensure that software systems are scalable, maintainable, and meet user requirements, enhancing the overall quality and performance of the final product. Mastery of these techniques aids in problem-solving and fosters innovation in software development.

techniques_and_tools_for_application_man.name: Techniques and Tools for Application Management
techniques_and_tools_for_application_man.description: Techniques and Tools for Application Management involves the knowledge and use of methodologies, frameworks, and software tools to effectively oversee application development and operations. It encompasses areas such as project management, performance monitoring, and version control, ensuring applications run efficiently and meet user requirements. Professionals utilize this skill to streamline workflows, enhance collaboration among teams, and address issues proactively, ultimately improving the overall quality and reliability of software applications.

techniques_and_tools_for_asset_liability.name: Techniques and Tools for Asset Liability Management
techniques_and_tools_for_asset_liability.description: Techniques and Tools for Asset Liability Management encompasses various techniques and tools used to monitor, measure, and manage the risks arising from asset-liability mismatches, interest rate fluctuations, liquidity constraints, and other factors.

techniques_and_tools_for_embedded_value.name: Techniques and Tools for Embedded Value
techniques_and_tools_for_embedded_value.description: Techniques and Tools for Embedded Value: Embedded Value is a financial metric used in insurance and financial services industries to assess the value of future profits embedded in an insurance portfolio. Professionals in the finance division need to be proficient in techniques and tools for calculating and analyzing embedded value, which may include methodologies like traditional or market-consistent embedded value calculations.

techniques_and_tools_for_multichannel_ma.name: Techniques and Tools for Multichannel Management
techniques_and_tools_for_multichannel_ma.description: Techniques and Tools for Multichannel Management involve strategies and resources used to oversee and optimize customer interactions across various channels, including email, social media, websites, and in-store experiences. This skill enables organizations to deliver a consistent and seamless customer experience, enhance engagement, and improve sales performance. It encompasses the use of analytics, customer relationship management (CRM) systems, and marketing automation tools to effectively coordinate communication and marketing efforts across multiple platforms.

technology_architecture.name: Technology Architecture
technology_architecture.description: Architecture of indiviudal technical components and their structured solutions

telephone_skills.name: Telephone Skills
telephone_skills.description: Proficiency in utilizing effective techniques for managing telephone communications within the sales division. This skill involves mastering etiquette, active listening, and persuasive communication skills to engage customers, handle inquiries or objections, and ultimately drive sales outcomes through phone interactions.

telon.name: TELON
telon.description: TELON is a specialized software tool used in the telecommunications industry for network planning and optimization. It enables users to simulate and analyze network performance, assess coverage, and optimize infrastructure deployment. By integrating various data inputs, TELON helps engineers make informed decisions about network designs, ensuring efficient resource allocation and improved service quality. This skill is essential for professionals involved in telecommunications project management and network engineering.

telugu.name: Telugu
telugu.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

tensorflow.name: TensorFlow
tensorflow.description: TensorFlow is an open-source machine learning framework developed by Google for building and training machine learning models. This skill involves: Developing machine learning models using TensorFlow, including tasks such as data preprocessing, model architecture design, training, evaluation, and deployment.

teradata.name: Teradata
teradata.description: Teradata is a popular relational database management system (RDBMS) known for its scalability and parallel processing capabilities, commonly used for data warehousing and analytics. This skill involves: Database administration, SQL query optimization, data modeling, performance tuning, and managing Teradata databases to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval.

terminal_access_controller_access_contro.name: Terminal Access Controller Access-Control System (TACACS)
terminal_access_controller_access_contro.description: TACACS (Terminal Access Controller Access-Control System) is a network security protocol used for authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) services. It provides a centralized method for controlling access to network devices and resources by requiring users to authenticate with a username and password. TACACS operates by separating the authentication, authorization, and accounting functions into distinct processes, enabling more granular control over user access privileges and actions. It is commonly used in enterprise networks to manage administrative access to routers, switches, and other network devices, enhancing security and accountability. This skill entails implementing a centralized method for controlling access to network devices and resources by requiring users to authenticate with a username and password.

terraform.name: Terraform
terraform.description: Infrastructure as code (IaC) tool to build, change, and version infrastructure

territorial_analysis_models.name: Territorial Analysis Models
territorial_analysis_models.description: Territorial Analysis Models involve using statistical and spatial analysis techniques to analyze geographic regions and understand spatial patterns, relationships, and trends. Professionals with this skill employ geographic information systems (GIS), spatial statistics, and spatial econometrics to study various aspects of territories, such as demographics, land use, economic activity, and environmental factors.

test_case_development.name: Test Case Development
test_case_development.description: Test case development entails creating detailed instructions or procedures to verify the functionality, performance, and usability of software applications. This skill involves: Understanding software requirements, identifying test scenarios, designing test cases with clear steps and expected outcomes, documenting test data and preconditions, and ensuring comprehensive test coverage.

test_engineering.name: Test Engineering
test_engineering.description: Test engineering involves designing, implementing, and maintaining test processes, methodologies, and infrastructure to ensure the quality and reliability of software products. This skill involves: Developing test strategies, creating test plans, designing test environments, executing tests, analyzing test results, identifying defects, and collaborating with development teams to improve product quality.

test_management_in_projects.name: Test Management in Projects
test_management_in_projects.description: Expertise in planning, coordinating, and executing testing activities within a project, including test planning, test case design, test execution, defect management, and reporting to ensure the quality of project deliverables.

test_portfolio_management.name: Test Portfolio Management
test_portfolio_management.description: Test portfolio management refers to the strategic planning, prioritization, and coordination of multiple testing efforts across various projects or applications within an organization. This skill involves: Assessing testing needs, prioritizing testing activities, allocating resources, managing test schedules and budgets, monitoring test progress, and ensuring alignment with business objectives and priorities.

test_driven_development.name: Test-Driven Development
test_driven_development.description: Test-driven development is a software development approach where automated tests are written before the implementation code, guiding the design and development process. This skill involves: Writing failing unit tests based on requirements, writing code to pass the tests, refactoring code to improve design and maintainability, and repeating the cycle to iteratively develop and enhance software functionality.

text_analytics_techniques.name: Text Analytics Techniques
text_analytics_techniques.description: Machine learning techniques used to automatically extract valuable insights from unstructured text data

text_mining.name: Text Mining
text_mining.description: Text mining involves the process of deriving meaningful patterns, insights, and knowledge from large volumes of unstructured textual data. This skill involves: Preprocessing text data, performing tasks such as tokenization, stemming, and lemmatization, applying techniques like sentiment analysis, topic modeling, and named entity recognition, and extracting valuable information to support decision-making processes.

thai.name: Thai
thai.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

the_machine_learning_pipeline_on_aws.name: The Machine Learning Pipeline on AWS
the_machine_learning_pipeline_on_aws.description: The machine learning pipeline on AWS refers to the end-to-end process of building, deploying, and managing machine learning models using Amazon Web Services. This skill involves: Data preprocessing and feature engineering, model training and evaluation, model deployment using AWS services like SageMaker, monitoring model performance and scalability, and iterating on the pipeline to improve model accuracy and efficiency.

the_open_group_architecture_framework_to.name: The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF)
the_open_group_architecture_framework_to.description: Enterprise architecture framework providing best practices and guidance for professionals involved in designing, planning, implementing, and governing an enterprise’s information technology architecture

third_party_and_workers_liability.name: Third Party and Workers' Liability
third_party_and_workers_liability.description: This skill focuses on the design and management of insurance products that provide coverage for third-party liability and workers' compensation. It involves assessing the potential liabilities faced by businesses and individuals, such as bodily injury or property damage to third parties and employees' injuries or illnesses arising from work-related activities.

third_party_risk_management.name: Third Party Risk Management
third_party_risk_management.description: Third-party risk management involves assessing and managing risks associated with the use of external vendors, suppliers, service providers, or partners who have access to the organization's systems, data, or operations. This skill encompasses identifying, evaluating, and monitoring risks posed by third parties, such as cybersecurity risks, compliance risks, operational risks, reputational risks, or business continuity risks.

threat_intelligence.name: Threat Intelligence
threat_intelligence.description: Threat Intelligence is the process of gathering, analyzing, and interpreting information about potential threats to an organization’s cybersecurity. This skill involves understanding the tactics, techniques, and procedures used by cyber adversaries, enabling organizations to proactively defend against attacks. By utilizing threat intelligence, security teams can prioritize vulnerabilities, enhance incident response, and make informed decisions, ultimately reducing risk and improving overall security posture. Effective threat intelligence is crucial for staying ahead of evolving cyber threats.

thunderhead.name: Thunderhead
thunderhead.description: Thunderhead is a customer engagement platform that enables organizations to deliver personalized and interactive communications across multiple channels. This skill involves: Configuring Thunderhead's platform to design and deliver personalized customer communications, integrating with customer data sources and CRM systems, analyzing customer interactions and engagement metrics, and optimizing communication strategies.

tibco.name: TIBCO
tibco.description: TIBCO is a software company that provides integration, analytics, and event processing solutions for businesses to connect and unify their digital ecosystem. This skill involves: Implementing and configuring TIBCO's integration and analytics products, designing and deploying event-driven architectures, developing and managing business processes, and optimizing data flows and communication channels.

time_management.name: Time Management
time_management.description: Time Management is the process of organizing and planning how to divide your time between specific activities.

togglz.name: Togglz
togglz.description: Togglz is a Java library that provides feature toggles (also known as feature flags) to control the activation and deactivation of features in software applications. This skill involves: Integrating Togglz into Java applications, defining and managing feature toggles for different environments, implementing conditional logic based on feature states, and dynamically controlling application behavior without redeploying code.

tomcat.name: Tomcat
tomcat.description: Apache Tomcat is an open-source web server and servlet container that is used to deploy and manage Java web applications. This skill involves: Installing and configuring Tomcat server environments, deploying web applications to Tomcat, managing server resources and performance, troubleshooting issues related to deployment and runtime, and ensuring the reliability and security of web applications hosted on Tomcat servers.

tortoisesvn.name: TortoiseSVN
tortoisesvn.description: TortoiseSVN is a graphic user interface-based version control system that simplifies the management of files and directories within Subversion (SVN). It allows users to track changes, collaborate on projects, and maintain version history without needing extensive command-line knowledge. This skill is particularly useful for software development, documentation management, and project collaboration, enabling teams to efficiently manage updates, reversions, and file integrity over time.

tosca.name: TOSCA
tosca.description: TOSCA (Test Orchestration for Service Component Architecture) is a modeling language used for automating application testing and deployment within cloud environments. It enables the definition of test cases, environments, and configurations in a platform-independent manner. TOSCA facilitates efficient test management, integration, and orchestration, allowing teams to enhance collaboration, reduce testing time, and ensure consistent quality across different components of a software application throughout its lifecycle. It is particularly valuable in DevOps practices and continuous testing.

tosca_automation_architecture.name: TOSCA Automation Architecture
tosca_automation_architecture.description: Mastery in designing and implementing automation solutions using the TOSCA (Topology and Orchestration Specification for Cloud Applications) standard. This skill involves expertise in architecting automation frameworks, defining test cases, and orchestrating automated testing processes across complex IT environments. It also includes governance of automation processes to ensure alignment with organizational strategies, standards, and best practices.

toxicity_management.name: Toxicity Management
toxicity_management.description: Toxicty Management involves managing or mitigating toxic elements or risks within IT operations or asset lifecycle governance processes. This might involve implementing safeguards, monitoring systems, or automated checks to detect and address potentially harmful or disruptive issues that could affect the stability or security of IT systems or assets.

traditional_underwriting_channel.name: Traditional Underwriting Channel
traditional_underwriting_channel.description: Traditional Underwriting Channel proficiency and expertise

training_delivery.name: Training Delivery
training_delivery.description: The ability to successfully  present and lead discussions, demonstrations, and exercises or activities to help  learners gain the required knowledge and skills for performing a task or learning a subject.

training_facilitation.name: Training Facilitation
training_facilitation.description: Training Facilitation involves guiding and managing learning experiences to ensure participants achieve desired outcomes. It requires creating engaging environments, using effective communication, and employing interactive techniques to enhance understanding and retention of knowledge.

training_needs_analysis.name: Training Needs Analysis
training_needs_analysis.description: Training Needs Analysis is the process of identifying gaps in employee skills and knowledge to determine the necessary training interventions. It involves assessing current competencies, setting learning objectives, and developing targeted training programs to enhance workforce capabilities.

transact_sql_t_sql.name: Transact SQL (T-SQL)
transact_sql_t_sql.description: Transact SQL (T-SQL) is an extension of SQL (Structured Query Language) used primarily with Microsoft SQL Server. It enables users to manage and manipulate relational databases through advanced querying capabilities, including data retrieval, insertion, updating, and deletion. T-SQL also supports procedural programming, allowing for the creation of functions and stored procedures. This skill is essential for database administrators, data analysts, and developers to execute complex queries efficiently and handle large datasets effectively.

transfer_pricing.name: Transfer Pricing
transfer_pricing.description: Transfer Pricing in insurance refers to the practice of setting prices for intercompany transactions between different entities within the same insurance group. It involves determining the prices or premiums charged for reinsurance, retrocession, and intra-group services to ensure they reflect fair market value and comply with tax regulations.

transmission_control_protocolinternet_pr.name: Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP)
transmission_control_protocolinternet_pr.description: TCP/IP (Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol) is the suite of communication protocols used to connect devices over the internet and other networks. This skill involves: Understanding the fundamentals of TCP/IP networking, including IP addressing, subnetting, routing, TCP and UDP protocols, and troubleshooting network connectivity issues.

transport_services.name: Transport Services
transport_services.description: Transport Services involves managing transportation services for employees, clients, and stakeholders of an insurance company.

travel_advisory.name: Travel Advisory
travel_advisory.description: Travel Advisory encompasses arranging and coordinating travel-related services for employees, clients, and business partners of an insurance company.

travel_management.name: Travel Management
travel_management.description: Travel Management is the process of managing corporate travel expenses and activities, including airline, hotel, and car rental booking, as well as reimbursement, compliance, and reporting. Travel Management enables companies to manage their travel spend across multiple suppliers and policies to optimize their budgets effectively. It involves the integration of multiple tools, systems, and processes to build an efficient, cost-effective travel program. This includes booking tools, travel policy enforcement, data analytics, and reporting. Travel Management also involves the management of traveler safety, security, and health, including health and safety risk assessments, traveler tracking, and travel risk management. It also includes the analysis of trends and data related to travel bookings and expenses to identify areas of improvement and cost savings. Finally, Travel Management also includes the administrative tasks associated with travel, such as expense reporting and reimbursement processing.

travis_ci.name: Travis CI
travis_ci.description: Hosted continuous integration service  to test and deploy software projects

treasury_information_systems_and_info_pr.name: Treasury Information Systems and Info Providers
treasury_information_systems_and_info_pr.description: Treasury Information Systems and Info Providers involves proficiency in utilizing treasury information systems (TIS) and accessing information from various providers to support treasury operations and decision-making processes. Treasury information systems are software solutions designed to facilitate cash management, liquidity forecasting, risk management, and other treasury functions. Proficiency in this skill includes understanding how to use TIS platforms effectively, analyzing and interpreting financial data from different sources, integrating information from multiple systems, and leveraging external information providers such as financial market data vendors or credit rating agencies.

treasury_tools.name: Treasury Tools
treasury_tools.description: Fundamentals of Treasury Tools involves understanding the essential tools and techniques used in treasury management to optimize liquidity, manage financial risk, and support investment strategies. Professionals with this skill are proficient in utilizing a range of treasury tools, including cash flow forecasting models, liquidity management systems, and risk hedging instruments such as derivatives and forwards.

treaty_administration.name: Treaty Administration
treaty_administration.description: Proficiency in administering reinsurance treaties, which encompasses tasks such as policy issuance, premium billing, claims handling, and contract management for treaty reinsurance business. This skill involves ensuring compliance with treaty terms and conditions, accurately recording and reporting treaty transactions, and maintaining effective communication between the ceding insurer and the reinsurer throughout the treaty period.

trello.name: Trello
trello.description: Trello is a visual project management tool that uses boards, lists, and cards to organize tasks and workflows. It enables individuals and teams to collaborate effectively by tracking progress, assigning responsibilities, and managing deadlines. Users can customize boards for various projects, add attachments, set due dates, and integrate with other applications. Trello enhances productivity by providing a clear overview of tasks, making it easier to prioritize and streamline workflows in both personal and professional contexts.

trend_micro.name: Trend Micro
trend_micro.description: Trend Micro is a cybersecurity skill that involves utilizing Trend Micro's software solutions to protect networks, devices, and data from cyber threats. It encompasses threat detection, prevention, and response strategies against malware, ransomware, and other security vulnerabilities. This skill is essential for maintaining organizational security posture, ensuring data privacy, and managing vulnerabilities within IT infrastructure, thereby safeguarding sensitive information against evolving cyber risks.

trend_micro_intrusion_prevention_system_.name: Trend Micro Intrusion Prevention System (IPS)
trend_micro_intrusion_prevention_system_.description: Trend Micro Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) is a cybersecurity solution that identifies and blocks potential threats in real-time to protect networks and systems. This skill involves configuring, managing, and optimizing the IPS to detect malicious activities, such as network breaches or malware attacks. It is used to enhance security posture by preventing unauthorized access and ensuring the integrity and confidentiality of sensitive data, thereby safeguarding organizational assets against evolving cyber threats.

turkish.name: Turkish
turkish.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

turkmen.name: Turkmen
turkmen.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

type_script.name: Type Script
type_script.description: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and other advanced features to enhance the development of large-scale JavaScript applications. This skill involves: Writing and maintaining TypeScript code, defining interfaces and types, leveraging TypeScript's features such as classes, modules, and generics, transpiling TypeScript code to JavaScript, and integrating TypeScript into web development workflows.

typography.name: Typography
typography.description: Typography refers to the art and technique of arranging typefaces, fonts, and text elements to enhance readability, visual appeal, and communication effectiveness in marketing materials, branding collateral, and digital content.

ui_architecture.name: UI Architecture
ui_architecture.description: UI Architecture refers to the structural design of user interfaces in software applications. It involves creating a framework that organizes components, defines interactions, and ensures a cohesive and intuitive user experience. This skill is essential for designing interfaces that are not only visually appealing but also functional, facilitating smooth navigation and effective communication between the user and the application. UI Architecture is crucial for enhancing usability and optimizing user satisfaction in digital products.

ui_design.name: UI Design
ui_design.description: UI design, or user interface design, involves the process of designing the visual layout and interactive elements of digital products to ensure a user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing experience. This skill involves: Conducting user research and analysis, creating wireframes and prototypes, designing user interfaces with consideration for usability and accessibility principles, collaborating with stakeholders and developers, and iterating designs based on feedback and testing.

ui_path.name: UI Path
ui_path.description: UI Path is a leading Robotic Process Automation (RPA) tool that enables organizations to automate repetitive tasks by creating software robots (bots) that mimic human interactions with user interfaces. This skill involves: Developing automation workflows using UI Path Studio, capturing user interface interactions and automating tasks without coding, configuring and orchestrating bots in the UI Path Orchestrator, monitoring bot performance and troubleshooting issues, and optimizing automation processes.

ui_prototyping.name: UI Prototyping
ui_prototyping.description: UI prototyping involves the creation of interactive mockups or prototypes that simulate the functionality and user experience of a digital product before development begins. This skill involves: Using prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, or Figma to design and prototype user interfaces, creating interactive prototypes with clickable elements and transitions, gathering feedback from stakeholders and users, and refining prototypes based on usability testing and design iterations.

ui_testing.name: UI Testing
ui_testing.description: UI testing involves the process of evaluating the functionality, usability, and performance of a software application's user interface to ensure it meets the intended requirements and delivers a satisfactory user experience. This skill involves: Planning and designing UI test cases, executing tests manually or using automated testing tools like Selenium or Cypress, verifying UI elements, interactions, and visual designs, identifying and reporting defects, and collaborating with developers to resolve issues.

ui_tools.name: UI Tools
ui_tools.description: UI Tools are software applications and frameworks used by designers and developers to create, prototype, and optimize user interfaces for websites and applications. These tools facilitate the design process by providing features like drag-and-drop components, interactive elements, and responsive design options. They enhance user experience (UX) by enabling clear communication of ideas, streamlining collaboration between teams, and ensuring consistency and accessibility in digital products. Examples include Sketch, Figma, and Adobe XD.

ukrainian.name: Ukrainian
ukrainian.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

uml_diagramming_visio.name: UML Diagramming (Visio)
uml_diagramming_visio.description: UML (Unified Modeling Language) diagramming involves creating visual representations of software systems using standardized symbols and notations to facilitate communication and understanding among stakeholders. This skill involves: Creating UML diagrams such as use case diagrams, class diagrams, sequence diagrams, and activity diagrams using tools like Microsoft Visio, modeling software systems and their components, documenting system architecture and behavior, and communicating design decisions to team members and stakeholders.

understanding_financial_metrics_and_rela.name: Understanding Financial Metrics and Related Models
understanding_financial_metrics_and_rela.description: Understanding Financial Metrics and Related Models involves comprehending various financial metrics and the models used to analyze them. It includes understanding key performance indicators (KPIs) such as revenue growth, profitability ratios, liquidity ratios, solvency ratios, and efficiency ratios.

underwriting.name: Underwriting
underwriting.description: Proficiency in the foundational principles and practices of underwriting in the insurance industry. This skill involves assessing risks associated with insurance applications, evaluating factors such as applicant demographics, health status, and lifestyle habits to determine insurability and premium rates, and making underwriting decisions based on established guidelines and risk assessment models.

underwriting_and_pension_management_proc.name: Underwriting and Pension Management Processes
underwriting_and_pension_management_proc.description: Proficiency in managing the underwriting and pension processes within an insurance organization. This skill involves assessing risks associated with pension plans, evaluating applications for pension coverage, determining appropriate coverage levels and premiums, and managing the administrative aspects of pension plans, including enrollment, contributions, and payouts.

underwriting_and_protection_management_p.name: Underwriting and Protection Management Processes
underwriting_and_protection_management_p.description: Competence in overseeing the underwriting and protection management processes in an insurance company. This skill encompasses evaluating insurance applications, assessing risks associated with various types of coverage, determining coverage terms and premiums, and issuing insurance policies. It also involves managing policyholder information, handling policy changes and endorsements, processing claims, and ensuring adherence to underwriting guidelines and regulatory requirements.

underwriting_division_at_insurers.name: Underwriting Division at Insurers
underwriting_division_at_insurers.description: The underwriting division within an insurance company is responsible for assessing and managing risks associated with insurance policies. Underwriters evaluate insurance applications, analyze risk factors, determine coverage eligibility, and set appropriate premium rates based on the assessed risk. This skill involves understanding insurance underwriting principles, guidelines, and processes specific to various lines of insurance, such as property, casualty, life, health, or specialty insurance.

underwriting_procedures_and_policy_manag.name: Underwriting Procedures and Policy Management
underwriting_procedures_and_policy_manag.description: Underwriting Procedures and Policy Management proficiency and expertise

unified_communications.name: Unified Communications
unified_communications.description: Unified Communications (UC) is the integration of various communication tools and platforms, such as voice, video, messaging, and collaboration software, into a single cohesive system. This skill enhances real-time communication within organizations, streamlining workflows and improving collaboration among teams. It is used to facilitate seamless interactions, reduce response times, and promote more efficient information sharing, ultimately enhancing productivity and fostering a connected workplace environment.

unified_functional_testing.name: Unified Functional Testing
unified_functional_testing.description: UFT is a comprehensive test automation tool provided by Micro Focus, formerly known as HP QuickTest Professional (QTP), used for functional and regression testing of software applications. This skill involves: Creating automated test scripts using UFT's scripting language (VBScript), recording and playback of user interactions, parameterization and data-driven testing, designing and executing test scenarios, analyzing test results, and integrating with test management tools.

unified_storage_system.name: Unified Storage System
unified_storage_system.description: A unified storage system is a storage solution that consolidates file-based and block-based storage protocols into a single platform, providing centralized management and simplified storage provisioning. This skill involves: Configuring and managing unified storage systems, provisioning storage resources for both file and block storage needs, optimizing storage performance and efficiency, implementing data protection and disaster recovery measures, and integrating with existing IT infrastructure.

unit_testing.name: Unit Testing
unit_testing.description: Unit Testing is the practice of verifying that individual components or modules of a software application perform as intended. It involves writing and executing test cases to validate the functionality, quality, and reliability of individual components'/modules' code, often using automated testing frameworks. Unit testing is essential for catching bugs early, facilitating code refactoring, and ensuring code maintains its intended behavior over time.

unix.name: Unix
unix.description: Unix is a powerful, multiuser operating system known for its stability, security, and flexibility. It is commonly used in servers, workstations, and embedded systems. The skill encompasses knowledge of Unix commands, shell scripting, file management, and system administration. Proficiency in Unix allows users to efficiently manage and automate tasks, troubleshoot issues, and navigate the command line interface. This skill is essential for roles in software development, IT support, and system engineering.

unix_shell_scripting.name: Unix Shell Scripting
unix_shell_scripting.description: Unix shell scripting involves writing scripts using shell commands and syntax to automate tasks and perform system administration tasks on Unix-based operating systems. This skill involves: Writing shell scripts using shell languages such as Bash, Korn, or C shell, using shell commands for file manipulation, process management, and system configuration, debugging and troubleshooting scripts, scheduling and executing script jobs, and incorporating control structures and variables to enhance script functionality.

unleash_io.name: Unleash.io
unleash_io.description: Unleash.io is a feature flagging and experimentation platform that enables software teams to manage feature releases, perform A/B testing, and control feature toggles in their applications. This skill involves: Configuring feature flags and toggles using Unleash.io's platform, integrating feature flags into application codebases, conducting feature experiments and measuring their impact, managing feature lifecycles and rollouts, and collaborating with development teams to implement feature flagging strategies.

urdu.name: Urdu
urdu.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

us_gaap.name: US GAAP
us_gaap.description: US GAAP involves understanding and applying the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) set by the United States Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB). It encompasses the rules and guidelines for financial accounting and reporting, including standards for recognition, measurement, presentation, and disclosure of financial information in financial statements.

usability_testing.name: Usability Testing
usability_testing.description: Usability testing involves evaluating the ease of use and effectiveness of a software application or product by observing users as they interact with it and collecting feedback to identify usability issues and areas for improvement. This skill involves: Planning and designing usability test scenarios and tasks, recruiting participants representative of the target user demographic, conducting usability tests in controlled environments or remotely, analyzing user behavior and feedback, documenting usability findings, and recommending design changes based on usability test results.

usage_of_eclipse_abap_cloud_environment.name: Usage of Eclipse ABAP Cloud Environment
usage_of_eclipse_abap_cloud_environment.description: Eclipse ABAP Cloud Environment is an integrated development environment (IDE) for SAP ABAP development in the cloud, providing tools and features for building and deploying ABAP-based applications on SAP Cloud Platform. This skill involves: Setting up and configuring Eclipse ABAP Cloud Environment for development projects, writing and debugging ABAP code, integrating with SAP Cloud Platform services, managing development artifacts and repositories, collaborating with team members using version control systems, and deploying ABAP applications to cloud environments.

user_experience_design_ux.name: User Experience Design (UX)
user_experience_design_ux.description: Holistic and seamless user experience design by understanding user needs, conducting research and designing intuitive interfaces

user_interaction.name: User Interaction
user_interaction.description: User Interaction is the process of communication between a user and an application, system, or device. It includes all interactions between a user and a system, including user input, feedback, navigation, and other usability measures. It includes characteristics such as usability, accessibility, navigation, responsiveness, and user-friendliness. In order to create a successful user experience, interfaces should enable users to easily accomplish their tasks and objectives with minimal effort. This includes providing simplified displays, understandable language, and a clear and consistent layout. User interaction also involves designing user-centric features that meet the user’s needs and goals such as providing help and tutorials. Additionally, user interaction covers creating a system that is able to process user input and provide feedback in a timely manner to ensure a good user experience.

user_interface_design.name: User Interface Design
user_interface_design.description: Design of vidual elements and interactive components of a product that user directly interact with

user_needs_analysis.name: User Needs Analysis
user_needs_analysis.description: User needs analysis is the process of gathering, analyzing, and prioritizing user requirements and preferences to inform the design and development of products and services that meet user needs effectively. This skill involves: Conducting user research through methods such as surveys, interviews, and observations, identifying user personas and user stories, eliciting and documenting user requirements, prioritizing requirements based on user feedback and business objectives, validating requirements with stakeholders, and iterating on designs based on user needs and feedback.

user_story_writing.name: User Story Writing
user_story_writing.description: User story writing is a technique used in agile development methodologies to capture requirements from an end-user perspective. User stories are concise descriptions of a feature or functionality written from the user's point of view. This skill involves: Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, translating requirements into user stories using the As a [user], I want [feature] so that [benefit] format, prioritizing user stories based on business value and dependencies, refining user stories through discussions and feedback, and maintaining a backlog of user stories for sprint planning.

user_centered_design.name: User-Centered Design
user_centered_design.description: Design approach actively involving users  througout the entireprocess of planning, designing and developing a product

ux_design.name: UX Design
ux_design.description: UX (User Experience) design focuses on creating meaningful and enjoyable experiences for users when interacting with products or services. It encompasses aspects such as usability, accessibility, and emotional impact. This skill involves: Conducting user research to understand user needs and behaviors, creating user personas and journey maps, wireframing and prototyping user interfaces, conducting usability testing and gathering feedback, iterating designs based on user input, collaborating with cross-functional teams (e.g., designers, developers, product managers), and ensuring consistency and coherence in the user experience across digital touchpoints.

ux_principles.name: UX Principles
ux_principles.description: UX principles are fundamental guidelines and best practices that inform the design and evaluation of user experiences. They encompass principles related to usability, accessibility, visual design, and interaction design. This skill involves: Understanding and applying principles such as usability, accessibility, learnability, consistency, simplicity, and feedback, considering user needs and goals in design decisions, adhering to design patterns and conventions, conducting heuristic evaluations to assess usability against established principles, and advocating for user-centered design practices within the organization.

ux_processes.name: UX Processes
ux_processes.description: UX processes refer to the methods and workflows used to design and deliver user experiences. These processes typically involve stages such as research, design, prototyping, testing, and iteration. This skill involves: Planning and executing UX research activities, such as user interviews, surveys, and usability tests, synthesizing research findings to inform design decisions, creating design artifacts such as wireframes, mockups, and prototypes, conducting usability testing to validate design assumptions, iterating on designs based on user feedback, and collaborating with stakeholders throughout the design process.

ux_tools.name: UX Tools
ux_tools.description: UX Tools refer to various software and methodologies used by designers to create and evaluate user experiences. This skill involves proficiency in tools for wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and design collaboration. It enables designers to visualize ideas, gather user feedback, and iterate designs effectively, ensuring that products are user-centered and meet the needs of their audience. Mastery of UX tools ultimately enhances product usability and satisfaction.

ux_writing.name: UX Writing
ux_writing.description: UX writing involves crafting clear and concise copy for user interfaces to guide users and enhance their experience. It focuses on delivering relevant information and instructions in a user-friendly manner. This skill involves: Understanding user needs and context to tailor messaging appropriately, writing microcopy for interface elements such as buttons, labels, and tooltips, ensuring consistency and clarity in language across the product, collaborating with designers and developers to integrate copy seamlessly into the user interface, and iterating on copy based on user feedback and usability testing.

uyghur.name: Uyghur
uyghur.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

uzbek.name: Uzbek
uzbek.description: This skill encompasses proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as understanding grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances of a the language.

valuation_methods.name: Valuation Methods
valuation_methods.description: Demonstrates the application of valuation methods.

valuation_of_available_technologies_on_t.name: Valuation of Available Technologies on the Market
valuation_of_available_technologies_on_t.description: Valuation of Available Technologies on the Market involves assessing and determining the value of technologies available in the market, such as software, hardware, and intellectual property assets.

value_added_tax_regulations.name: Value Added Tax Regulations
value_added_tax_regulations.description: Fundamentals of Value Added Tax (VAT) Regulations involves understanding the basic principles, rules, and procedures governing Value Added Tax in a specific jurisdiction. Professionals with this skill are knowledgeable about VAT legislation, regulations, and compliance requirements applicable to businesses and individuals. They comprehend key concepts such as taxable supplies, input tax, output tax, VAT rates, exemptions, and registration thresholds.

value_stream_mapping.name: Value Stream Mapping
value_stream_mapping.description: Value Stream Mapping (VSM) is a visual tool used in lean management to analyze and design the flow of materials and information required to bring a product or service from inception to delivery. It helps identify waste, streamline processes, and enhance efficiency by mapping out each step in a process, highlighting areas for improvement. VSM enables organizations to optimize resources, reduce lead times, and improve overall value delivery to customers.

value_stream_modeling_software.name: Value Stream Modeling Software
value_stream_modeling_software.description: Value Stream Modeling Software is a tool used in Lean management to analyze and design the flow of materials and information required to bring a product or service to a consumer. This software helps organizations to visualize their processes, identify inefficiencies, and find ways to improve overall productivity. It can be used in a variety of industries, including manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, and software development. The software provides a visual representation of the entire process, from the initial stages of production to the final delivery of the product or service. This allows for a better understanding of how value is created and how waste can be eliminated.

various_branches_system.name: Various Branches System
various_branches_system.description: The Various Branches System is a multi-disciplinary approach used in fields such as computer science, project management, and organizational theory. It involves categorizing distinct areas of knowledge or operation into manageable branches, enabling streamlined decision-making and efficient resource allocation. This skill is essential for analyzing complex systems, fostering collaboration across departments, and enhancing innovation by ensuring that diverse perspectives and specialties are effectively integrated.

vault.name: Vault
vault.description: Vault is a secure and centralized platform for managing and storing sensitive information such as passwords, encryption keys, and access tokens. It provides features for access control, versioning, and auditing. This skill involves: Setting up and configuring Vault instances for specific use cases, defining and managing access policies and roles, storing and retrieving sensitive data securely, integrating Vault with other systems and applications, monitoring and auditing access and usage of secrets, and ensuring compliance with security standards and regulations.

vector_databases.name: Vector Databases
vector_databases.description: Vector databases are data storage systems optimized for handling vector-based data structures, commonly used in applications such as geographical information systems (GIS), real-time analytics, and machine learning. This skill involves: Understanding the principles of vector data storage and retrieval, designing and implementing vector database schemas tailored to specific use cases, optimizing queries and indexing for efficient data access, managing data integrity and consistency, and integrating vector databases with other systems and tools in the data pipeline.

veeam.name: VEEAM
veeam.description: VEEAM is a backup, replication, and disaster recovery software suite designed for virtualized environments, including VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-V. It provides data protection and management solutions for virtual machines and cloud workloads. This skill involves: Installing and configuring VEEAM Backup and Replication software, creating backup and replication jobs to protect virtual machines and data, scheduling backup tasks and managing retention policies, monitoring backup performance and storage usage, performing data recovery and disaster recovery operations, and ensuring data integrity and compliance with backup policies and regulations.

vendor_due_diligence.name: Vendor Due Diligence
vendor_due_diligence.description: Vendor Due Diligence involves the comprehensive assessment and evaluation of third-party vendors, suppliers, or service providers before engaging in business relationships or partnerships.

vendor_evaluation.name: Vendor Evaluation
vendor_evaluation.description: Vendor evaluation is the process of assessing and selecting suppliers based on criteria such as quality, cost, reliability, and service. It involves analyzing vendor performance, capabilities, and compliance to ensure they meet organizational needs and standards.

vendor_management.name: Vendor Management
vendor_management.description: Vendor Management entails overseeing the performance, compliance, and relationships of vendors supplying goods and services to insurers.

verbal_communication_skills.name: Verbal Communication Skills
verbal_communication_skills.description: Verbal Communication refers to the ability to convey information clearly and effectively through spoken language, ensuring understanding and engagement.

verint_wfm.name: Verint WFM
verint_wfm.description: Verint WFM is a workforce management software solution that helps organizations optimize employee scheduling, forecasting, and performance management. It provides tools for aligning workforce resources with operational demands and service level objectives.
